Description:
b"As a Stock Processing and Placement Associate, you will be an integral part of bringing the magic of Macy\xe2\x80\x99s to life. \xc2\xa0Associates in this role perform a number of functions that are critical to offering our customers the best experience when they shop in our store. While all positions require working as part of a team to meet department and store objectives, your individual responsibilities based on your position.Details on our two key support positions, the Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associate and the Retail Merchandise Placement Associate are listed below:
Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associate Overview: Your individual responsibilities may include the timely execution of the receiving process, delivering merchandise to the floor for placement, ensuring floor readiness by store opening, keeping the selling floor stocked with merchandise, and organizing the selling floor and stock areas. Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associates may also assist with clearing out fitting rooms, recover the selling floor by folding and rehanging merchandise, and preparing merchandise for shipping to customers.
In order to present our customers with the best shopping experience, most of our Truck Processing and Handling Associates start their workday early in the morning or late in the evening to ensure we are ready to make Macy's magic. Some locations even have overnight processing schedules. Associates will have the opportunity to work a flexible schedule, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends and busy events such as the day after Thanksgiving and the day after Christmas.
Any scheduled hours listed in the job posting title are subject to change based on business needs. All associates may be required to work hours other than those stated in the job posting title on weekends or on key events, such as the Friday after Thanksgiving.
Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associate Essential Functions:

Unload and unpack new merchandise shipments, and prepare them for the selling floor by folding, hanging, or stacking
Deliver new merchandise to the appropriate department for placement on the selling floor or stock area
Organize and maintain merchandise in stockrooms, and fill in the selling floor as needed
Learn Macy's systems and procedures to enhance selling efficiencies and complete support duties
Collect damaged merchandise from designated areas and accurately complete required paperwork
Restock register wrapstand supplies and collect hangers
Assist with the pulling and preparation of merchandise for shipment to customers
Provide support for major sales events
Participate as needed in selling floor recovery, including folding and hanging merchandise and restocking the selling floor
Perform other duties as assigned
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associate Qualifications:

Education/Experience: No specific education or experience required
Communication Skills: Ability to read and interpret documents such as memos, safety rules, policies and procedures. Ability to communicate effectively with peers and management
Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities, and learn new procedures. Ability to work as part of a team, but also able to complete tasks independently with little supervision
Physical Demands: Position may include frequent lifting, bending, reaching, and the use of ladders and other equipment
Other Skills: Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude
Work Hours: Available to work a flexible schedule, which may include early morning, evening, overnight, weekends holidays, and major sales events. Hours are subject to change based on business needs

Retail Merchandise Placement Associate Overview: Your individual responsibilities may include placement of new merchandise receipts on the selling floor, moving merchandise to prepare for sales events, pulling merchandise for shipping to customers, and completing price changes. Retail Merchandise Placement Associates may also assist with clearing out fitting rooms, recover the selling floor by folding and rehanging merchandise, and organizing the selling floor and stock areas.
In order to present our customers with the best shopping experience, most of our Merchandise Placement Associates start their workday early in the morning or late in the evening to ensure we are ready to make Macy's magic. Some locations even have overnight schedules. Associates will have the opportunity to work a flexible schedule, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends and busy events such as the day after Thanksgiving and the day after Christmas.\xc2\xa0
Any scheduled hours listed in the job posting title are subject to change based on business needs. All associates may be required to work hours other than those stated in the job posting title on weekends or on key holiday events, such as the Friday after Thanksgiving.
Retail Merchandise Placement Associate Essential Functions:

Placement of merchandise in the selling floor or stock area
Assist in price changing execution
Organize and maintain merchandise in stockrooms, and fill in the selling floor as needed
Learn Macy's systems and procedures to enhance selling efficiencies and complete support duties
Pull merchandise for online customers and deliver to the designated area on the Receiving Dock
Assist in the preparation of merchandise for shipment to customers
Provide support for major sales events
Participate as needed in selling floor recovery, including folding and hanging merchandise and clearing fitting rooms
Performs other duties as assigned
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Retail Merchandise Placement Associate Qualifications:

Education/Experience: No specific education or experience required
Communication Skills: Ability to read and interpret documents such as memos, safety rules, policies and procedures. Ability to communicate effectively with peers and management
Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability: Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities, and learn new procedures. Ability to work as part of a team, but also able to complete tasks independently with little supervision
Physical Demands: Position may include frequent lifting, up to 50 lbs., bending, reaching, and the use of ladders and other equipment
Other Skills: Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude
Work Hours: Available to work a flexible schedule, which may include early morning, evening, and weekends, holidays and major sales events. Hours subject to change based on business needs

These job descriptions are not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend these job descriptions at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
\xc2\xa0
Updated Date:\xc2\xa01/2/14"
Title: b'Stock Processing and Placement Associate'

Description:
b"Our stores are where the ultimate magic of Macy's comes to life, and our Sales Associates are vital to delivering customer service that offers a distinctive shopping experience and drives sales results. While all positions within Macy's require working as part of a team to meet department and store objectives, your individual responsibilities as a Sales Associate may include demonstrating outstanding customer service and selling skills, keeping the selling floor stocked with merchandise and ready for sales events, or organizing the selling floor and stock areas.
Depending on location, we offer different types of Sales Associate positions, including Hourly Sales Associate and Commissioned Sales Associate roles. The Hiring Manager conducting your interview will detail the type of position you\xe2\x80\x99re interviewing for during your appointment, and you will have the opportunity to ask questions at that time.
Holiday Sales Associates will have the same responsibilities on a temporary basis.
Essential Functions:

Meeting and making a connection with customers, asking questions and listening to shoppers' needs, then giving options and advice on meeting those needs 
Inspiring the customer to buy, celebrating the purchase, and creating a lasting positive impression of you, Macy's, and the purchase 
Ensuring that fitting rooms are ready for customers by promptly clearing our merchandise and returning it to the proper area of the selling floor 
Maintaining selling floor presentations, and restocking them as needed 
Learning Macy's systems and procedures to enhance selling efficiencies and complete support duties 
Handle all returns courteously and professionally 
Responsible for achieving personal sales goals and Star Reward goals 
Maintain a professional attitude with sincerity and enthusiasm reflecting Macy\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to our customer \xe2\x80\x93 the most important person in our stores 
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures 
Develop product knowledge by reading current vendor tags and pamphlets and attending training classes in order to communicate it to the customer 
Be aware of current promotional events and sales 
Maintain good housekeeping standards 
Adhere to Loss Prevention and inventory control and compliance procedures 
Perform other duties as assigned 
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality 

Qualifications

Education/Experience:\xc2\xa0 Previous retail sales experience preferred, but not required
Communication Skills:\xc2\xa0 Strong interpersonal and communication skills. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to effectively communicate with customers, peers, and management.\xc2\xa0 Ability to communicate on the telephone with proper etiquette.
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Ability to use a calculator and calculate percentages and ratios.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to make change in American monetary units.
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Ability to multi-task, while being attentive to customers and remaining flexible to the needs of the business.\xc2\xa0 Ability to work as part of a team and take initiative independent of direct supervision.
Physical Demands:\xc2\xa0 This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, grabbing and standing for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders.\xc2\xa0 Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.\xc2\xa0 Involves lifting at least 30 lbs.
Other Skills:\xc2\xa0 Enthusiastic, friendly, and energetic with a genuine desire to provide outstanding service.
Work Hours:\xc2\xa0 Available to work a variety of hours, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends, and overnight shifts.

This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. \xc2\xa0
Updated\xc2\xa0Date:\xc2\xa0 1/2/14"
Title: b'Sales Associate'

Description:
b"(To return to the overview, please click your browser back button)
You will have the opportunity to help others look their best every day with a role in Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Cosmetics Department. You\xe2\x80\x99ll make one-on-one connections with customers to learn their sense of beauty and style, develop your artistic side though customer consultation and make-up and product application, and attain a sense of accomplishment when your selling skills combine with your passion for beauty to reach personal and team sales goals. Previous cosmetics experience is nice to have, but it is not required to begin a career in beauty at Macy\xe2\x80\x99s.
Seasonal associates perform the same tasks and functions as a regular associate in the same role, but for a temporary period of time, typically through December 26, although some positions may work a few weeks longer.
There are two key Cosmetic Department roles:Cosmetic Beauty Advisor and Cosmetic Counter Manager
Cosmetic Beauty Advisor Essential Functions

Initiate service consultations to determine the customer\xe2\x80\x99s preferences and buying/service needs; explain and demonstrate use of cosmetics through actual application
Partner with Sales Manager and Counter Manager to identify business driving opportunities and stock needs 
Develop a repeat-business customer base in order to regularly communicate: upcoming events, new merchandise receipts and product replenishment to increase incremental sales
Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority
Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer in making the best choice
Attend product training classes and seminars
Achieve Scorecard and counter goals
Participate in pre-selling and sales driving events as well as processing of new receipts, damages, testers, and return to vendors (RTVs)\xc2\xa0
Maintain high customer readiness standards by ensuring proper presentation, organization, storing, and replenishment of stock as well as good housekeeping standards
Serve as Role Model/Mentor to new hires
Proficient in POS systems including Search and Send and My Client
Ensure safety and shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Perform other customer-facing duties as needed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0Cosmetic Beauty Advisor Qualifications

Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High school diploma or equivalent. \xc2\xa0Previous cosmetic or fragrance sales experience a plus
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret labels including warnings and ingredient lists on products. \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to customers, vendors, buyers, peers, and all levels of management
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator and calculate percentages and ratios. \xc2\xa0Must be able to make change in American monetary units
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, grabbing and also standing for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. \xc2\xa0Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. \xc2\xa0Involves lifting at least 40 lbs.
Other Skills: \xc2\xa0Superior organizational and time management skills. \xc2\xa0Must be able to build relationships and influence others. \xc2\xa0Ability to set and achieve goals. \xc2\xa0Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. \xc2\xa0Must possess a strong sense of urgency and a thirst for knowledge. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lead by example
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Ability to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, holidays, and sales events, based on department and store/company need

\xc2\xa0
Cosmetic Counter Manager Essential Functions

Recruit, train, coach, motivate, and develop new and incumbent beauty advisors on company policies and procedures, product knowledge, and personal and department productivity goals
Role model expectations through initiating service consultations, sharing technique and product knowledge through actual application, and developing a repeat-business customer base
Sell merchandise through exceptional customer service techniques and professional selling skills to reach personal productivity goals
Develop and implement business-driving events and ensure proper execution to achieve counter productivity goals 
Communicate productivity goals, monitor associate productivity levels, and provide coaching and feedback
Review and analyze business performance of daily, weekly, monthly, seasonal, and annual sales results
Supervise proper presentation, organization, storing, a replenishment of stock
Ensure timely processing of new receipts, damages, testers, and return to vendors (RTVs) through delegation to self and staff
Communicate regularly with vendors, planners, and buyers regarding stock needs, customer preferences, and special events
Attend product training classes and seminars 
Participate in pre-selling and sales driving events
Maintain high customer readiness standards by ensuring proper presentation, organization, storing, and replenishment of stock as well as good housekeeping standards
Proficient in POS systems including Search and Send and My Client
Participate in physical inventory process
Ensure safety and shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Perform\xc2\xa0other customer-facing, duties as needed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Cosmetic Counter Manager Qualifications\xc2\xa0

Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High school diploma or equivalent. \xc2\xa0A minimum of one year of previous selling experience required, preferably in Cosmetics. \xc2\xa0Previous supervisory experience preferred
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret general business reports and labels including warnings and ingredient lists on products. \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to customers, vendors, buyers, peers, and all levels of management
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator and calculate percentages and ratios. \xc2\xa0Must be able to make change in American monetary units
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to anticipate and solve problems
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, grabbing and standing for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0May occasionally involve to stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. \xc2\xa0Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. \xc2\xa0Involves lifting at least 40 lbs.
Other Skills: \xc2\xa0Superior organizational and time management skills. \xc2\xa0Must be able to build relationships and influence others. \xc2\xa0Ability to set and achieve goals. \xc2\xa0Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. \xc2\xa0Must possess a strong sense of urgency and a thirst for knowledge. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lead by example
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Ability to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, holidays, and sales events, based on department and store/company needs

These job descriptions are not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend these job descriptions at any time. Macy's Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
\xc2\xa0

Title: b'Cosmetics Associate'

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
As the Herald Square Administrative Support Team (AST) Manager, you will manage the AST Supervisors in supporting Macy's M.O.M. strategy within the Herald Square district. \xc2\xa0The primary focus is to ensure operational efficiency to achieve sales, service and profit goals. With training, coaching and development, the AST team will follow and grow through your leadership.\xc2\xa0 You will need to effectively communicate and downstream information to all District and Store leadership within the building. The scope of your authority will extend to key areas such as expense management; general administrative functions; staffing and scheduling; customer service; building and equipment maintenance; cash office functions; safety standards. 
Essential Functions:
Schedule Requirements

Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and store/company needs which may include day, evening, weekends and/or holidays. \xc2\xa0Typical schedule requires 6 out of 12 weekends/1-2 nights until closing Monday-Saturday/2 weekends off
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Sales

Drive overall Store Scorecard results by focusing efforts on general administrative functions \xc2\xa0
Ensure all payroll expenses are on budget
Keep non-payroll supply budget logs and balance store checkbook
Review schedule edits and monitor weekend compliance in partnership with Store Manager & Operations Manager
Establish high level of shortage awareness and effectiveness; ensure that all policies and procedures, are implemented, understood and executed by Herald Square AST Team
Ensure accuracy and distribution of all reporting; using Microsoft Excel, Vlookup, Macros and Pivot Tables to produce Herald Square specific reports.

Customer

Train, motivate and develop Herald Square AST to reach their fullest potential and to maximize business opportunities
Clearly communicate store and Company objectives so both Stores Team and AST Team so they are well informed
Direct total store maintenance; create a safe and clean environment for both customers and Associates
Manage supply budgets and ensure store stays in stock on selling supply and other required items
Maintain high level of wrapstand; integrity for EGC, loyalty, retain policies and cash fraud devices
Provide leadership to the store and all team members that focuses on a high energy, high morale store with Customer Service as the top priority
Ensure accurate timekeeping/payroll reports and that attendance from employees is managed
Act as liaison between systems & technology team and stores\xc2\xa0

People

\xc2\xa0Lead team of AST Associates through Supervisors; ensure workload appropriately allocated for timely and accurate completion
Recruit and hire results-oriented AST Supervisors and\xc2\xa0 Associates
Create a positive, inclusive work environment focusing on internal and external customer service and safety
Address Associate concerns in a reasonable and fair manner, consistent with the values expected by the Company
Monitor and address performance issues on a timely basis; administer Responsibility Based Performance as needed
Provide input to AST Associate performance evaluations and ensure coaching is in place for continued development
Act as liaison for District Human Resource office for all HR issues
Lead Associates in support of community service opportunities\xc2\xa0
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

Education/Experience - \xc2\xa0High School degree or equivalent and a minimum of 1-3 years in a leadership/supervisory position in a service driven environment
Communication Skills - Ability to read, write, and interpret instruction documents such as reports and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Mathematical Skills - Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability - Ability to effectively plan and execute strategies. Effective prioritizing and time management skills and knowledge of payroll systems.
Physical Demands - This position involves regular walking, standing, hearing, and talking. Involves standing a minimum of two consecutive hours and may occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders and reaching above eye level.
Other skills - Must be proficient in Microsoft Office. Strong working knowledge of Word, Access, PowerPoint, Excel using Pivot Tables, Macros and Vlookup and web enabled due diligence research. Strong leadership profile and excellent negotiation skills. Ability to build partnerships and direct teams. Commitment to exemplifying the highest integrity and professional business standards.
Work Hours - Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and store/company needs. Typical schedule requires 6 out of 12 weekends/ 1-2 nights to close Mon-Sat/2 weekends off.

________________________________________________________________________________
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Prepared Date: 2.25.14
\xc2\xa0

Title: b"Administrative Support Team Manager - Macy's Herald Square:"

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
As the Administrative Support Team Associate, you will support seven stores within the Herald Square District. Your primary focus is to serve and connect with the internal and external customers to address their needs. \xc2\xa0This position will support the Store Management teams and ensure timely distribution of all communication from Macy's portal to store team members, support the stores in all reporting needs including confidential and sensitive company information, coordinate and track the implementation of ongoing training, execute operational administrative functions, oversee timekeeping, scheduling maintenance, handle the Staffing functions as the Staffing liaison for associates in the \xc2\xa0as well as all sensitive customer issues. \xc2\xa0Administrative Support Team Associates are results oriented, demonstrate strong technical skills, have a flexible work style and can do attitude.
Essential Functions:
Schedule Requirements:

Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and store/company needs which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays. \xc2\xa0Typical schedule requires 6 out of 12 weekends/1-2 nights until closing Monday-Saturday/2 weekends off
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

General Administrative Functions:

Coordinate distribution of all incoming communication, including phone, fax, mail, network printer, Stores Portal, and e-mail
Review Stores Portal \xe2\x80\x9cRecently Added Documents\xe2\x80\x9d twice daily (morning before store opening & late afternoon); print and distribute appropriately
Complete and distribute Store newsletter and distribute other employee communication
Service all customers who visit the Store Manager\xe2\x80\x99s office for assistance
Handle all customer correspondence
Maintain store bulletin board program
Administration of the Safety program and accident reporting process
Produce and distribute all reporting; using Microsoft Excel, Vlookup, Macros and Pivot Tables to produce Herald Square specific reports\xc2\xa0

Human Resources Functions

Act as liaison for District Human Resource office for all HR issues; this will require handling of confidential and sensitive company documents
Review weekly training compliance report and make corrections, as needed
Coordinate and schedule all in-store training
Monitor new hire orientation and training sessions as needed
Act as a resource to all employees on, and promotes the usage of, Employee Self Service vehicles
Maintain store Associate Locker program
Distribute and follow-up on all timekeeping reporting with store management teams
Distribute and follow-up on all timekeeping and compliance reporting with store management teams
Coordinate all associate benefit events (eg Blood Drive, Flu Shot, Engagement Survey)

\xc2\xa0Operational Functions:

Keep non-payroll supply budgets; logs and balances store checkbook.\xc2\xa0 Review seasonal payroll/non-payroll budgets provided by Operations Director \xe2\x80\x93 Front of House.
Complete monthly legal compliance audits and submits online.
Maintain/orders store supplies via Oracle
Act as liaison between MST and store, and trains Associates and Sales Managers on how to call in repairs
Maintain phone lists and Associate information binders at POS
Key store operations contact
Participate in administrative inventory assistance
Open work orders submitted for maintenance and follow up on progress
Maintain daily fill-in of EGC\xe2\x80\x99s and credit applications
Update emergency contact lists as needed\xc2\xa0

Staffing Functions:

Act as liaison for District Staffing office for all Staffing issues and objectives
Print Current and Future week(s) scheduling reports: Open Hours, Area Walk Report, Weekend Compliance, Daily Timekeeping
Record and maintain Key Event Planner information, distribute with Area Walk Reports for EIC
Ensure syntax errors are updated timely
Coordinate Annual Vacation solicitation from Associates
Coordinate FWT communication \xe2\x80\x93 including: Rally information, POS/policy updates, scorecard overview, compliance to OCA Program
Coordinate FWT solicitation of open hours \xe2\x80\x93 including: communication of self-services expectations, direct solicitation of priority shifts, and maintenance of required hours worked.\xc2\xa0 Note: Schedule analytics (coverage, productivity, trend) remain as Store and Sales Manager responsibilities.\xc2\xa0 Scheduling Edits should only be completed at the request of the Store Manager.
Monitor weekend compliance in partnership with Store Manager and Sales Managers
Coordinate and ensure completion of Option and Availability selections by Associates and assisting Associates with self-selection troubleshooting

\xc2\xa0Qualifications:

Education/Experience - High School degree or equivalent and minimum 2 years of administrative experience
Communication Skills - Ability to read, write, and interpret instruction documents such as reports and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong customer service orientation.
Mathematical Skills - Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability - Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team, and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands - This position involves regular walking, standing, hearing, and talking. Involves standing a minimum of two consecutive hours and may occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders and reaching above eye level.
Other skills - Ability to follow through on projects in a timely manner. \xc2\xa0Must be comfortable with the use of computers with advanced technical skills; Proficient in Excel, Word, Lotus Notes; ability to use Excel Vlookup, Macros and Pivot Tables to break down and provide specific store reporting
Work Hours - Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and store/company needs. Typical schedule requires 6 out of 12 weekends/ 1-2 nights to close Mon-Sat/2 weekends off.

_________________________________________________________
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
\xc2\xa0
Prepared Date: 2.25.14"
Title: b"Administrative Support Team Associate - Macy's Herald Square:"

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
As the Administrative Support Team (AST) Supervisor, you will support the M.O.M. strategy by performing all functions of an Administrative Support Team Associate; in addition, you will be supervising the Administrative Support Team to ensure operational efficiently to achieve sales, service and profit goals. \xc2\xa0Your role will include the training, coaching and development of the AST team, \xc2\xa0You will need to prioritize workload, effectively communicate and downstream information to store leadership. \xc2\xa0The scope of your authority will extend to key areas such as expense management; general administrative functions; staffing and scheduling; customer service; building and equipment maintenance; cash office functions; safety standards.
Essential Functions:
Schedule Requirements:\xc2\xa0

Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and store/company needs which may include day, evening, weekends and/or holidays. \xc2\xa0Typical schedule requires 6 out of 12 weekends/1-2 nights until closing Monday-Saturday/2 weekends off
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality\xc2\xa0

General Administrative Functions:

\xc2\xa0Supervise HS AST team inclusive of reception and administration to provide cross-functional flexibility
\xc2\xa0Delegate workload and follow up for completion based on workload calendar and outline priorities
Communicate status of workload and adherence of established standards to Store Leadership and ensure all issues are appropriately handled
Supervise and coordinate distribution of all incoming communication, including phone, fax, mail, network printer, Stores Portal, and e-mail
Supervise the distribution of the Stores portal communication \xe2\x80\x9cRecently Added Documents\xe2\x80\x9d twice daily (morning before store opening & late afternoon) to stores team
Ensure AST completes and distribute Daily Star Store newsletter and other employee communications
Train AST Associates to service all customers who visit the Store Manager\xe2\x80\x99s office for assistance
Supervise all customer correspondence
Supervise administration of the Safety Program and accident reporting process
Supervise accuracy and distribution of all reporting; using Microsoft Excel, Vlookup, Macros and Pivot Tables to produce Herald Square specific reports.\xc2\xa0

Act as liaison for District Human Resource office for all HR issues
Review weekly training compliance report and make corrections, as needed
Supervise and coordinate schedule of all in-store training
Distribute and follow-up on all compliance reporting
Be a resource and instruct all employees on, and promote the usage of, Employee Self Service vehicles
Supervise Associate locker program; ensure maintained and well executed

\xc2\xa0Operational Functions:

Supervise non-payroll supply budget logs and balance store checkbook\xc2\xa0
Completes monthly legal compliance audits and submits online
Supervise and maintain supplies and order as needed
Act as liaison between systems & technology team and stores
Ensure all Associates and Sales Managers are trained on how to call in repairs
Coordinate all systems rollouts and open tickets
Supervise key store operations contact; Maintain phone lists and Associate information binders at POS
Participate in administrative inventory assistance
Train AST and Stores Team to submit open work orders for maintenance and follow up on progress
Coordinate the placement of maintenance of all RF equipment for maximum use of Key Day events
Maintain high level of wrapstand; integrity for EGC, loyalty, retain policies and cash fraud devices\xc2\xa0

Cash Office Functions:

Supervise the maintenance of\xc2\xa0 Lost & Found records; Ensure Lost & Found is staffed accordingly on a daily basis
Train AST to replace lost gift cards and resolve customer issues with debit card and EFT transactions
Supervise all daily Vault tasks; cash deposit, balance vault, replenish registers, balance change drawers and all other Cash functions
Research and resolve cash shortage-as needed
Supervise all unique Herald Square cash vault functions\xc2\xa0

Staffing Functions:

Act as liaison to District Staffing office for all Staffing issues and objectives
Supervise and coordinate Printing of Current and Future week(s) scheduling reports
Review schedule edit requests with AST Manager, Store Manager & Operations Manager; complete with approval
Ensure syntax errors are updated timely
Coordinate Annual Vacation solicitation from AST Associates
Supervise and train AST Team to communicate with FWT of self-services expectations, direct solicitation of priority shifts, and maintenance of required hours worked and solicit FWT when there are open hours. Note: Schedule analytics (coverage, productivity, trend) remain as Store and Sales Manager responsibilities.\xc2\xa0 Scheduling Edits should only be completed at the request of the Store Manager
Supervise and coordinate production of Key Event Planning documents
\xc2\xa0Supervise\xc2\xa0 the record and maintain Key Event Planner information, distribute with Area Walk Reports for EIC
\xc2\xa0Monitor weekend compliance in partnership with AST Manager
\xc2\xa0Supervise and coordinate completion of Option and Availability selections by Associates and assisting Associates with self-selection troubleshooting\xc2\xa0

People:

Supervise \xc2\xa0team of AST Associates to ensure workload appropriately allocated for timely and accurate completion
Partner with AST Manager to interview and employ AST Associates who are results oriented
Create a positive, inclusive work environment resulting in retention of the best people and turnover reduction on AST Team
Address AST Associate concerns in a reasonable and fair manner, consistent with he values expected by the Company, partnering with the Store Manager when appropriate
Advise on administration of Responsibility Based Performance for AST Associates
Provide input to AST Associate performance evaluations and ensure coaching is in place for continued development
Ensure all procedures, policies and shortage programs are understood and executed by AST Associates
Lead AST Associates in support of community service opportunities\xc2\xa0

Qualifications:

Education/Experience - High School degree or equivalent with a minimum to 2 years of administrative experience preferred. Previous supervisory experience not required but highly recommended
Communication Skills - Ability to read, write, and interpret instruction documents such as reports and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Mathematical Skills - Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability - Ability to effectively plan and execute strategies. Effective prioritizing and time management skills. Knowledge of payroll systems.
Physical Demands - This position involves regular walking, standing, hearing, and talking. Involves standing a minimum of two consecutive hours and may occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders and reaching above eye level.
Other skills - Motivated self-starter, able to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.\xc2\xa0 Ability to build partnerships and direct teams. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office. Strong working knowledge of Word, Access, PowerPoint, Excel using Pivot Tables, Macros and Vlookup and web enabled due diligence research. Strong leadership profile and excellent negotiation skills. Commitment to exemplifying the highest integrity and professional business standards.
Work Hours - Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and store/company needs. Typical schedule requires 6 out of 12 weekends/ 1-2 nights to close Mon-Sat/2 weekends off.

___________________________________________________________________________________________
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Prepared Date: 2.25.14
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0"
Title: b"Administrative Support Team Supervisor - Macy's Herald Square:"

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
The Cosmetic Sales Associate is responsible for providing professional service to customers by selling and demonstrating cosmetics and related items, as well as contributing to the success contributing to the success of the department through achieving personal sales goals.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:

Acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner within 30 seconds of their entry into the area
Handle all returns courteously and professionally
Sell cosmetics and related merchandise according to customer service techniques and professional selling skills
Determine customer needs based on personal features and other customer preference related factors
Explain and demonstrate use of cosmetics through actual application
Responsible for achieving personal sales goals
Use clientele program to maintain customer profile and contact information to increase personal sales
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
Alert Cosmetic Counter Manager or Cosmetic Sales Manager of inventory and other inaccuracies
Attend product training classes and seminars
Ensure proper presentation, organization, storing, and replenishment of stock
Participate in pre-selling and sales driving events to maximize sales
Ensure timely processing of new receipts, damages, testers, and return to vendors (RTVs)
Maintain good housekeeping standards
Ensure work area is free from hazards and work in a safe manner
Adhere to Loss Prevention control and compliance procedures
Be in compliance with all hygiene standards
Perform other duties as needed

Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High School Diploma or equivalent. \xc2\xa0Previous selling experience is required, preferably in cosmetics.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0 Ability to read, write, and interpret labels including warnings and ingredient lists on products. \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate with customers, peers, and management.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator. \xc2\xa0Must be able to calculate percentages and ratios. \xc2\xa0Must be able to make change using American monetary units.
Reasoning Ability: Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing. \xc2\xa0Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs. \xc2\xa0May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders. \xc2\xa0Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Superior organizational and time management skills. \xc2\xa0Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. \xc2\xa0Must be able to build relationships and influence others. \xc2\xa0Must possess a thirst for knowledge.
Working Conditions: \xc2\xa0Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. \xc2\xa0Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.
Macy's Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. \xc2\xa0
Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of\xc2\xa0SFPC Art. 49."

Title: b'Cosmetic & Fragrance Business Manager:'

Description:
b'(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
General Summary:\xc2\xa0
The Cosmetics Rotator is responsible for providing professional service to customers by selling and demonstrating cosmetics and related items, as well as contributing to the success contributing to the success of the department through achieving personal sales goals in multiple stores within the district.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner within 30 seconds of their entry into the area
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Handle all returns courteously and professionally
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Sell cosmetics and related merchandise according to customer service techniques and professional selling skills
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Determine customer needs based on personal features and other customer preference related factors
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Explain and demonstrate use of cosmetics through actual application
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Responsible for achieving personal sales goals
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Use clientele program to maintain customer profile and contact information to increase personal sales
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Alert Cosmetics Counter Manager or Cosmetics Sales Manager of inventory and other inaccuracies
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Attend product training classes and seminars
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Ensure proper presentation, organization, storing, and replenishment of stock
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Participate in pre-selling and sales driving events to maximize sales
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Ensure timely processing of new receipts, damages, testers, and return to vendors (RTVs)
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Maintain good housekeeping standards
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Ensure work area is free from hazards and work in a safe manner
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Adhere to Loss Prevention control and compliance procedures
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Be in compliance with all hygiene standards
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Travel to and work at other stores throughout the district as needed
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Perform other duties as needed
\xc2\xa0
Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High School Diploma or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 Previous selling experience is required, preferably in cosmetics.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret labels including warnings and ingredient lists on products.\xc2\xa0 Ability to effectively communicate with customers, peers, and management.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able touse a calculator.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to calculate percentages and ratios.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to make change using American monetary units.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0 This position requires constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders.\xc2\xa0 Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Superior organizational and time management skills.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to build relationships and influence others.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a thirst for knowledge.
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Working Conditions:
Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.\xc2\xa0 Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.'

Title: b'Fragrance Specialist:'

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
General Summary:
The Fragrance Counter Manager is responsible for supervising the complete operations of the fragrance line to ensure a high level of productivity and customer satisfaction through extensive product knowledge and outstanding customer service.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner within 30 seconds of their entry into the area
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Recruit, train, coach, motivate, and develop new and incumbent associates on company policies and procedures, product knowledge, and personal and department productivity goals
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Review and analyze business performance of daily, weekly, monthly, seasonal, and annual sales results
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Review advertising calendar and ensure proper execution of events
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Communicate credit goal specifics and expectations
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Monitor associate productivity levels and provide coaching and feedback
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Ensure timely processing of new receipts, damages, testers, and return to vendors (RTVs) through delegation to self and staff
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Develop and implement business driving events to achieve department goals
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Supervise proper presentation, organization, storing, and replenishment of stock
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Sell merchandise through effective customer service techniques and professional selling skills to reach personal productivity goals
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Alert Sales Manager of needs and concerns of the business and staff
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Communicate regularly with vendors, planners, distributors, and buyers regarding stock needs, customer preferences, and special events
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Participate in physical inventory process
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Maintain good housekeeping standards
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Ensure work area is free from hazards and work in a safe manner
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Be in compliance with all hygiene standards
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Perform other duties as needed
\xc2\xa0
Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0 High School Diploma or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 A minimum of one year of previous selling experience is required, preferably in fragrances.\xc2\xa0 Previous supervisory is also preferred.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0 Ability to read, write, and interpret general business periodicals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to customers, vendors, buyers, peers, and all levels of management.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able touse a calculator.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to calculate percentages and ratios.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to make change using American monetary units.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0 Must be able to anticipate and solve problems.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders.\xc2\xa0 Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Superior organizational and time management skills.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to build relationships and influence others.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a thirst for knowledge.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to lead by example.\xc2\xa0Working Conditions:
Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.\xc2\xa0 Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.
Macy's Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. \xc2\xa0
Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of\xc2\xa0SFPC Art. 49."

Title: b'Fine Jewelry Sales Associate:'

Description:
b'(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
General Summary:
The LP Detective\xe2\x80\x99s primary responsibility is to prevent the loss of company property while maintaining a safe business environment.\xc2\xa0 Support store\xe2\x80\x99s efforts in providing the best customer service within a controlled environment so as to ensure maximum sales at the highest profit rate attainable.\xc2\xa0 Under general supervision and established procedures, the LP Detective detects and apprehends shoplifters and dishonest employees.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Respond to customer and associate incidents to facilitate first aid and minimize company liability
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Recover stolen merchandise and apprehend shoplifters and other people who commit fraud or other criminal acts against the company
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Investigate criminal violations against the person or property of any customer or associate that is committed on company premises
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Prepare prompt and complete reports relative to all theft incidents, merchandise recoveries, accident investigations, audits, and other activities as assigned by the Loss Prevention Manager
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Have knowledge of and maintain strict compliance with the law and company policies concerning apprehensions, searches and seizures, and the preservation of evidence
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Promote shortage awareness and theft deterrence among associates by conducting meetings and participating in training events
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Successfully complete all security training requirements including CPR and First Aid and maintain personal certifications as required by law
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Conduct audits to ensure sales department compliance to merchandise exposure standards and loss prevention
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Testify in court concerning any case, criminal or civil, wherein the company is a party of interest to which the LP Store Detective is summoned
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Works on special assignments, investigations, and surveillance as directed by Store Loss Prevention Manager
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Responds to alarm conditions at assigned store
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Perform other duties as needed
\xc2\xa0
Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High School Diploma or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 Some college is desirable.\xc2\xa0 Completion of Store Agent Training program required upon assignment to position. \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, reports and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to communicate with peers, store staff, police, and customers.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of an organization.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0 Able to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to use judgment and apply common sense when carrying out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.\xc2\xa0 Able to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires regular walking, standing, hearing, and talking.\xc2\xa0 Extended periods of sitting are also required.\xc2\xa0 Some kneeling, stooping, crouching, or crawling may be required.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to move and/or lift at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.\xc2\xa0 Ability to use restraints in an apprehension.\xc2\xa0 Ability to sustain long periods of time enclosed in surveillance areas.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Must be able to operate cameras and other surveillance equipment.\xc2\xa0 Ability to think and act clearly in possible stressful and hostile situations.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Working Conditions:
This position is constantly exposed to potentially hazardous, stressful, and hostile situations.\xc2\xa0 Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.\xc2\xa0 Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.'

\xc2\xa0Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High School Diploma or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 Some college is desirable.\xc2\xa0 A minimum of one to two years of loss prevention experience.\xc2\xa0 Experience with trained K-9s is preferred.\xc2\xa0 Completion of Store Agent Training program and K-9 program are required upon assignment to position.

Title: b'Loss Prevention K-9 Unit Associate:'

Description:
b'(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
General Summary:
The Lead LP Detective\xe2\x80\x99s primary responsibility is to train, educate, and supervise staff in detecting and preventing theft of company property.\xc2\xa0 Train and coach LP staff on apprehension.\xc2\xa0 Support store\xe2\x80\x99s efforts in providing the best customer service within a controlled environment so as to ensure maximum sales at the highest profit rate attainable.\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Successfully complete all security training requirements including CPR and First Aid and maintain personal certifications as required by law
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Assist in training detectives in observation, theft detection, and apprehension techniques by utilizing the Buddy Program
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Testify in court concerning any case, criminal or civil, wherein the company is a party of interest to which the LP Store Detective is summoned
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Works on special assignments, investigations, and surveillance as directed by Store Loss Prevention Manager
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Responds to alarm conditions at assigned store and assist in store alarm tests
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Perform other duties as needed
\xc2\xa0
Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High School Diploma or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 Some college is desirable.\xc2\xa0 Six to 12 months loss prevention experience or training.\xc2\xa0 Completion of Store Agent Training program required upon assignment to position.\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Additional Store Agent Training is required for this level.
Language Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules,\xc2\xa0operating and maintenance instructions, reports and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to communicate with peers, store staff, police, and customers.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of an organization.
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able touse a calculator.\xc2\xa0 Able to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Must be able to use judgment and apply common sense when carrying out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.\xc2\xa0 Able to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Physical Demands:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0This position requires regular walking, standing, hearing, and talking.\xc2\xa0 Extended periods of sitting are also required.\xc2\xa0 Some kneeling, stooping, crouching, or crawling may be required.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to move and/or lift at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.\xc2\xa0 Ability to use restraints in an apprehension.\xc2\xa0 Ability to sustain long periods of time enclosed in surveillance areas.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Must be able to operate cameras and other surveillance equipment.\xc2\xa0 Ability to think and act clearly in possible stressful and hostile situations.\xc2\xa0Working Conditions:
This position is constantly exposed to potentially hazardous, stressful, and hostile situations.\xc2\xa0 Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.\xc2\xa0 Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.
\xc2\xa0'
Title: b'Store Detective II:'

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
OVERVIEW:\xc2\xa0
The Support Team Associate is responsible for the Merchandising, Fulfillment and BOPS process as well as achieving sales plan by ensuring proper product placement and flow of new receipts. They create an enhanced shopping experience and support the selling process by leveraging relationship throughout the store in order to attend to the customer. Other operational duties include floor moves, replenishment, inventory; shortage control, stockroom organization, and merchandising.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Process merchandise to floor ready standards and assist the Support Team Lead with the placement of merchandise on the sales floor
Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper.
Communicate issues to Manager and or Merchandise Team Lead
Assist the Support Team Lead in the movement of fixtures and merchandise for new product, season changes, and clearance sets
Process fulfillment orders to include; locating and picking merchandise for customer orders
Assist in replenishing stock onto the sales floor
Assist in the inventory process
Assist in markdown process
Participate in stockroom maintenance, organization, and housekeeping
Process damages, transfers, and return to vendor merchandise
Maintain high customer readiness standards by delivering a clean, neat, easy to shop store environment
Follows shortage programs and procedures as they pertain to the merchandising function
Place product to appeal to customer preference
Attend to customer service needs in a friendly and helpful manner when approached
Be sensitive to the store\xe2\x80\x99s needs and flex into other non-selling areas as needed
Assist with special projects as assigned
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0No specific educational accomplishments are necessary.\xc2\xa0
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. \xc2\xa0Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills:Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability:Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands: This position requires constant moving and standing. Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs. \xc2\xa0May occasionally be required to reach, stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders. \xc2\xa0May have to reach above eye level. Involves close vision, color vision, depth\xc2\xa0perception, and focus adjustment.
Other skills: Possess strong merchandising skills. Possess vision and creativity. Ability to collaborate and function as\xc2\xa0a member of a team. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team. \xc2\xa0Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours:Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends,and/or holidays.
\xc2\xa0"
Title: b'Support Associate:'

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
OVERVIEW: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
The Support Team Lead is responsible for the Merchandising, Fulfillment and BOPS process as well as achieving sales plan by ensuring proper product placement and flow of new receipts. They create an enhanced shopping experience and support the selling process\xc2\xa0by leveraging relationship throughout the store in order to attend to the customer. \xc2\xa0Other operational duties include floor moves, replenishment, inventory; shortage control, stockroom organization, and merchandising
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Motivate team to ensure that department goals of customer service, productivity, efficiency, and quality are being met and properly balanced
Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper.
Assist with, and supervise workload throughout the store in conjunction with Merchandising Team Manager
Organize fulfillment workload when MTM is off, and focus on re-checks and hard to find items
Process fulfillment orders to include, locating and picking merchandise for customer
Ensure all picked merchandise is delivered to the send area for the receiving team to pack and ship
Communicate with all MTMs, MSO, SSO, RTM, and VPSM to share fulfillment results
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, and flex between areas of the store and fulfillment functions, as directed by the Supervisor
Motivate team to ensure that department goals of customer service, productivity, efficiency, and quality are being met and properly balanced
Direct Merchandise Team in fulfillment picking, and in the placement of merchandise on the sales floor to ensure floor readiness
Educate, motivate, and develop team to ensure effective performance through consistent on-the-job training
Ensure all procedures, policies, and standards are understood and followed by associates
Oversee replenishment of stock onto the sales floor
Assist Merchandise Team Manager in the movement of fixtures and merchandise for new product, season changes, and clearance sets
Review the flow of merchandise on a daily basis
Assist in markdown and inventory process.
Oversee processing of damages, transfers, return to vendor merchandise, and stockroom maintenance
Maintain high customer readiness and standards by delivering a clean, neat, easy to shop store environment
Attend to customer service needs in a friendly and helpful manner when approached
Shift associates independently as workload demands
Communicate with MTMs and MSO/SSO on any merchandise or system issues
Assist other Merchandise Team Leads in performing all supervisor duties when the Merchandise Team Manager is out
Be sensitive to the needs of the store and flex into other non-selling areas as needed
Ensure that shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Perform other duties as needed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0
QUALIFICATIONS
Education/Experience: High School degree or equivalent. Minimum 1 year previous merchandising or retail operations Experience. Exceptional Customer Service Skills.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management.
Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability: Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands: This position involves heavy lifting and constant moving and standing. Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours. Involves lifting at least 30 lbs. May involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. May have to reach above eye level
Other skills:Ability to train, coach, and develop a staff of associates. Ability to delegate and follow through on projects in a timely manner. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours:Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays."

Title: b'Pricing Team Lead:'

Description:
b'(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
The Receiving Associate is responsible for all functions related to the receipt and processing of merchandise entering and leaving the building as well as the upkeep of merchandise within the store and maintaining the stockroom.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:

Unpack merchandise from vendor boxes and remove merchandise from plastic bags and packaging
Place sensors on goods according to MSS standards
Hang or fold merchandise and place on racks to be taken to the selling floor
Assist the Merchandise Team in the placement of merchandise received through shipment
Collect cardboard boxes and trash and discard in the appropriate compacting receptacle
Complete all processing and receiving activities in accordance with productivity standards timelines
Assist the Merchandise Team in the movement of fixtures and merchandise for new product, season changes, and clearance sets
Assist in replenishment of stock onto the sales floor
Assist in inventory process
Assist in markdown process
Responsible for customer carryout and special deliveries
Participate in stockroom maintenance, organization, and housekeeping
Process damages, transfers, and return to vendor merchandise
Maintain high customer readiness standards by delivering a clean, neat, easy to shop store environment
Follows shortage programs and procedures as they pertain to the receiving function
Daily hanger collection and sorting
Attend to customer service needs in a friendly and helpful manner when approached
Be sensitive to store\xe2\x80\x99s needs and flex into other non-selling areas as needed
Assist with special projects as assigned
Perform other duties as needed

Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: No specific educational accomplishments are necessary.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. \xc2\xa0Ability to communicate\xc2\xa0with peers and customers.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Physical Demands: This position requires heavy lifting, and constant moving and standing. \xc2\xa0Must be able to\xc2\xa0stand for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs. \xc2\xa0May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders. \xc2\xa0May have to reach above eye level.
Other skills: Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.
Working Conditions: \xc2\xa0This position requires constant handling of heavy and/or bulky items as well as sharp items such as box cutters, sensors, tagging guns, and pins. \xc2\xa0May be required to operate machinery such as balers and compactors. \xc2\xa0Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. \xc2\xa0Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.
\xc2\xa0'

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Be sensitive to store\xe2\x80\x99s needs and flex into other non-selling areas as needed
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Assist with special projects as assigned
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Perform other duties as needed

Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: No specific educational accomplishments are necessary.\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Language Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to communicatewith peers and customers.
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able to\xc2\xa0use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to multitask in a fast-paced environment.
Physical Demands:\xc2\xa0This position requires heavy lifting, and constant moving and standing.\xc2\xa0 Must be able tostand for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders.\xc2\xa0 May have to reach above eye level.

Title: b'Back of House Support Associate:'

Description:
b'(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
The Retail Sales Associate is responsible for providing outstanding customer service, meeting hourly sales and Star Rewards goals on a personal and departmental basis, and demonstrating superior product knowledge to customers. \xc2\xa0To create a shopping experience that will make the customer feel welcome and comfortable.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:

Acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner within 30 seconds of their entry into the area
Handle all returns courteously and professionally
Determine customer needs based on personal features and other customer preference related factors
Demonstrate knowledge of store products and services to build sales and minimize returns
Suggest additional merchandise to compliment customer selection
Offer to call other locations if merchandise is unavailable within store
Offer to put purchase on customer\xe2\x80\x99s Macy\xe2\x80\x99s charge account toward the end of the shopping experience
Reinforce customer\xe2\x80\x99s selection and package merchandise with care
Invite customers to come back and thank them by name whenever possible
Responsible for achieving personal sales goals and Star Reward goals
Maintain a professional attitude with sincerity and enthusiasm reflecting Macy\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to our customer-the most important person in our stores
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
Develop product knowledge by reading current vendor tags and pamphlets and attending training classes in order to communicate it to the customer
Be aware of current promotional events and sales
Maintain good housekeeping standards
Adhere to Loss Prevention and inventory control and compliance procedures
Perform other duties as needed

\xc2\xa0
Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: No specific educational accomplishment is required. \xc2\xa0No experience is required.
Language Skills: Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate with customers, peers, and management. \xc2\xa0Able to communicate on the telephone with proper etiquette.
Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator. \xc2\xa0Must be able to calculate percentages and ratios. \xc2\xa0Must be able to make change using American monetary units.
Reasoning Ability: Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Physical Demands: This position requires constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing. \xc2\xa0Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs. May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders. \xc2\xa0Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Must be able to function as part of a team. \xc2\xa0Possess a strong sense of urgency. \xc2\xa0Must enjoy meeting and interacting with customers. Possess a thirst for learning.
Working Conditions: \xc2\xa0Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. \xc2\xa0Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.
\xc2\xa0'

\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Be aware of back stock and fill as needed
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Be aware of current promotional events and sales
