Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High School Diploma or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 A minimum of six months related experience and/or training.
Language Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to customers, peers, and all levels of management.

Title: b'Retail Sales Associate - Base Plus Commission:'

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
The Draw vs. Commission Sales Associate is responsible for providing outstanding customer service, meeting hourly sales and Star Rewards goals on a personal and departmental basis, and demonstrating superior product knowledge to customers.\xc2\xa0 To create a shopping experience that will make the customer feel welcome and comfortable.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:

Acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner within 30 seconds of their entry into the area
Handle all returns courteously and professionally
Determine customer needs based on personal features and other customer preference related factors
Demonstrate knowledge of store products and services to build sales and minimize returns
Suggest additional merchandise to compliment customer selection
Offer to call other locations if merchandise is unavailable within store
Offer to put purchase on customer\xe2\x80\x99s Macy\xe2\x80\x99s charge account toward the end of the shopping experience
Reinforce customer\xe2\x80\x99s selection and package merchandise with care
Invite customers to come back and thank them by name whenever possible
Responsible for achieving personal sales goals and Star Reward goals
Maintain a professional attitude with sincerity and enthusiasm reflecting Macy\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to our customer-the most important person in our stores
Use clientele program to maintain customer profile and contact information to increase personal sales
Handle more difficult customer requests
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
Develop extensive product knowledge by reading current vendor tags and pamphlets
Attend additional training classes in order to communicate product benefits to the customer
Be aware of back stock and fill as needed
Be aware of current promotional events and sales
Maintain good housekeeping standards
Adhere to Loss Prevention and inventory control and compliance procedures
Perform other duties as needed

Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0No specific educational accomplishment is required.\xc2\xa0 At least six months to one year of previous selling experience is required.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to effectively communicate with customers, peers, and management.\xc2\xa0 Able to communicate on the telephone with proper etiquette.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to calculate percentages and ratios.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to make change using American monetary units.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders.\xc2\xa0 Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Must be able to function as part of a team.\xc2\xa0 Possess a strong sense of urgency.\xc2\xa0 Must enjoy meeting and interacting with customers.\xc2\xa0 Possess a thirst for learning.
Working Conditions: \xc2\xa0Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.\xc2\xa0 Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.
Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportuity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.\xc2\xa0
Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of\xc2\xa0SFPC Art. 49."

Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0No specific educational accomplishments are necessary. \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules,\xc2\xa0operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to communicatewith peers and customers.
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able to\xc2\xa0use a calculator.

Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires heavy lifting, and constant moving and standing.\xc2\xa0 Must be able tostand for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders.\xc2\xa0 May have to reach above eye level.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.
Working Conditions:
\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
This position requires constant handling of heavy and/or bulky items as well as sharp items such as box cutters, sensors, tagging guns, and pins.\xc2\xa0 May be required to operate machinery such as balers and compactors.\xc2\xa0 Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.\xc2\xa0 Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.'

OVERVIEW:
As the Michael Kors Fragrance and Beauty Collection Beauty Advisor you are accountable for achieving monthly sales goals by presenting and demonstrating all fragrance and color products, offering outstanding customer service, building and maintaining a loyal client base, providing clients with product knowledge, and working as part of a team to meet individual and department objectives. Positions vary by location and are part- time and full-time, flexibility is needed for retail hours, which includes evenings, weekends and holidays; maximizing sales during peak selling periods.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Achieves sales AUS and IPT goals while demonstrating prompt, courteous, knowledgeable and professional customer service
Greet customers in a timely, professional and engaging manner
Takes initiative to present and sell merchandise in a professional and proficient manner through product demonstrations, creating a desire for the brand and product
Maximize sales opportunity through Link Selling within all categories of the Michael Kors Fragrance and Beauty Collection
Provide honest and confident feedback to customers regarding products
Demonstrate commitment and ability to build customer relationships and loyalty through initiating service consultations, regular purchase follow-up and replenishment calls, and the maintenance of Macy\xe2\x80\x99s My Client Registry
Build lasting relationships with customers by contacting them to follow up on purchases, suggest new products and invite them to upcoming events. Possesses drive, is goal-oriented, has an entrepreneurial outlook \xc2\xa0
Ability to meet or exceed sales, customer service, and loyalty program standard
Attend and actively participate in training seminars provided by the company and other product knowledge and business-driving opportunities
Enjoy meeting and interacting with customers; demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude
Proactively seeks complete and accurate information on the features and benefits of the product line
Maintain counter and tester unit cleanliness and hygiene standards
Implement and maintain all visual merchandising standards as directed in the visual merchandising guideline
Perform daily department maintenance tasks including filling in stock, merchandising, and light cleaning
Consistently seek new trend and product knowledge to act as an expert for the customer
Consistently project appropriate professional brand image and adhere to dress code
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience:\xc2\xa0High School degree or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 Prior sales experience, preferably in Cosmetics or\xc2\xa0Fragrances.
Communication Skills:\xc2\xa0 Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety \xc2\xa0rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Ability to communicate with peers and customers.
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management\xc2\xa0skills.
Physical Demands:\xc2\xa0 This position requires constant moving and standing.\xc2\xa0 Job may involve standing for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Job involves \xc2\xa0lifting at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally be required to reach, stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders.\xc2\xa0 May have to reach above eye level.
Other skills:\xc2\xa0 Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a strong sense of urgency.\xc2\xa0 Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.\xc2\xa0 Knowledge of Lotus Notes 6, MS Excel, MS Word, and MW systems a plus
Work Hours:\xc2\xa0 Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays.'

Overview: \xc2\xa0
The\xc2\xa0Fine Jewelry\xc2\xa0Associate is responsible for providing outstanding customer service, meeting hourly sales and Star Rewards goals on a personal and departmental basis, demonstrating superior product knowledge to customers, and creating a shopping experience that will make the customer feel welcome and comfortable during the holiday season. Additionally, the Fine Jewelry Sales Associate is responsible for becoming an expert on the product in the department as well as developing and impacting the sales of the business in the department. \xc2\xa0Perform other duties as assigned.
Essential Functions:

Acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner within 30 seconds of their entry into the area
Develop a high level of product knowledge for the merchandise in the department by reading vendor tags, pamphlets, and attending training classes in order to communicate it to the customer.
Suggest additional merchandise to compliment customer selection and engage the customer
Offer to call other locations if merchandise is unavailable within store
Offer to put purchase on customer\xe2\x80\x99s Macy\xe2\x80\x99s charge account toward the end of the shopping experience
Reinforce customer\xe2\x80\x99s selection and package merchandise with care
Invite customers to come back and thank them by name whenever possible
Responsible for achieving personal sales goals and Star Reward goals
Use clientele program to maintain customer profile and contact information to increase personal sales
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
Alert Sales Manager of inventory and other inaccuracies
Ensure proper presentation, organization, storing, and replenishment of stock
Participate in pre-selling and sales driving events to maximize sales
Maintain good housekeeping standards
Ensure work area is free from hazards and work in a safe manner
Adhere to Loss Prevention and inventory control and compliance procedures
Regular, dependable attendance & punctuality

\xc2\xa0
Qualifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 High School Diploma or equivalent. Previous selling experience is required, preferably in fine jewelry.
Communication Skills:\xc2\xa0 Ability to read, write, and interpret product knowledge books.\xc2\xa0 Ability to effectively communicate with customers, peers, and management.\xc2\xa0
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to calculate percentages and ratios.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to make change using American monetary units. \xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Physical Demands:\xc2\xa0 This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing. Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Involves lifting at least 30 lbs. May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders.\xc2\xa0 Vision abilities include close vision, color vision,\xc2\xa0 depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.\xc2\xa0
Other skills:\xc2\xa0 Superior organizational and time management skills.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to build relationships and influence others.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a thirst for knowledge.\xc2\xa0
Work Hours:\xc2\xa0 Ability to work a flexible schedule, including mornings, evenings, and weekends, and busy\xc2\xa0events such as the day after Thanksgiving, special Big Event days, and the day after Christmas, based on department and store/company needs. \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Macy's Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. \xc2\xa0
Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of\xc2\xa0SFPC Art. 49.\xc2\xa0"

b'(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)

As a Fine Jewelry Sales Lead you will work with Jewelry Sales Manager to execute and control established Jewelry policies and procedures. The Fine Jewelry Business leader is responsible for supervising the complete operations
of the fine Jewelry counter to ensure a high level of productivity and customer satisfaction through extensive product knowledge and outstanding customer service. \xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

Review and analyze business performance of daily, weekly, monthly, seasonal, and annual sales results
Review advertising calendar and ensure proper execution of events
Sell merchandise through effective customer service techniques and professional selling skills to reach personal productivity goals
Monitor associate productivity levels and provide coaching and feedback
Communicate sales and credit goal specifics and expectations\xc2\xa0
Take initiative to present and sell merchandise in a professional and proficient manner through product demonstration
Achieve personal sales and credit goals by building customer relationships and loyalty through personal interaction, initiation of service consultations, and maintenance of a client file
Develop a repeat-business customer base in order to regularly communicate: upcoming events, new merchandise receipts \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0and product replenishment to increase incremental sales
Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by utilizing the Fine Jewelry Trade Up process
Recruit, train, coach, motivate, and develop new and incumbent associates on policies and procedures, product
Knowledge, and personal and counter productivity goals
Supervise proper presentation, organization, storing, and replenishment of stock
Alert Sales Manager of needs and concerns of the business and staff
Demonstrate effective Magic Selling behaviors to meet or exceed sales, customer service and Loyalty programs standards set by the company
Knowledge of the Fine and Bridge Jewelry Extended Service Plan and ability to drive ESP for self and department
Ensure accuracy of promotional presentation; communicate advertising and sales information to associates
Assist in the coordination of operational tasks as required such as, putting out new merchandise, sales and event set-up, price change, transfers, RTV\xe2\x80\x99s, and maintenance of safes and reserve locations
Communicates regularly with District Merchant and Planners regarding stock needs to drive top line sales
Educate peers on Product Knowledge
Demonstrate a professional, can-do attitude
Participate in physical inventory process
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to communicate with peers and customers

Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.

Title: b'Fine Jewelry Sales Lead:'

Description:
b'(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
General Summary:
The VSO\xe2\x80\x99s primary responsibility is to deter theft, communicate suspicious activity to the Loss Prevention Department, maintain a safe business environment, and provide strong customer service.\xc2\xa0 The VSO is primarily stationed at the customer entrances and monitors customer traffic entering and exiting the store.
\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Monitor customer traffic entering and exiting the store
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Communicate all suspicious activity to the Loss Prevention Department to prevent potential theft
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Responsible for reacting to alarm conditions at the doors should the EAS (Electronic Article Surveillance) system activate
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Provide strong customer service by ensuring that customers do not leave with an EAS tag on their purchases
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Monitor high shortage areas such as receiving and jewelry as needed 
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 May perform audit functions in high shortage areas
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Use two-way communication devices to maintain contact with Store Detectives to ensure store safety
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Prepare prompt and complete reports relative to all theft incidents, merchandise recoveries, accident investigations, audits, and other activities as assigned by the Loss Prevention Manager
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Have knowledge of and maintain strict compliance with the law and company policies concerning apprehensions, searches and seizures, and the preservation of evidence
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Works on special assignments, investigations, and surveillance as directed by Store Loss Prevention Manager
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Maintain a safe business environment
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Perform other duties as needed
\xc2\xa0
Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High School Diploma or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 Some college is desirable.\xc2\xa0 Completion of Store Agent Training program required upon assignment to position. \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, reports and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Ability to communicate with peers, store staff, police, and customers.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of an organization.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0 Able to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to use judgment and apply common sense when carrying out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.\xc2\xa0 Able to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires regular walki, standing, hearing, and talking.\xc2\xa0 Extended periods of sitting are also required.\xc2\xa0 Some kneeling, stooping, crouching, or crawling may be required.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to move and/or lift at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.\xc2\xa0 Ability to use restraints in an apprehension.\xc2\xa0 Ability to sustain long periods of time enclosed in surveillance areas.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Must be able to operate cameras and other surveillance equipment.\xc2\xa0 Ability to think and act clearly in possible stressful and hostile situations.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Working Conditions:
This position is exposed to potentially hazardous, stressful, and hostile situations.\xc2\xa0 Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.\xc2\xa0 Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.'

Description:

As a Macy\xe2\x80\x99s IMPULSE Beauty Artist and Sales Advisor, you will use your artistry, skills of superior product knowledge and passion for make-up and skin care to work in one of our most vibrant and exciting departments.\xc2\xa0 You will assist customers with the cosmetics artistry through a one-on-one customer relationship demonstrating expertise and passion for some of the most vibrant Cosmetics lines today such as Benefit, Tarte, Smashbox, Bare Escentuals and Urban Decay.\xc2\xa0 Through client development, you will build lasting customer relationships and help you to achieve personal and team selling and productivity goals. Performs other duties as assigned.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through the heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration
Take initiative to present and sell merchandise in a professional and proficient manner through artistry, product demonstration focusing on the features and benefits of the product line
Communicate with Counter Manager and Sales Manager\xc2\xa0 on ways to help drive the business, as well as in regards to stock needs, customer preferences, and special events
Participate in store and vendor training to elevate product knowledge and application techniques
Attend and actively participate in vendor meetings, seminars, schools, and other product knowledge and business-driving opportunities
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0
QUALIFICATIONS\xc2\xa0: 
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0Prior Cosmetics sales related experience and/or training. Proven experience in the development and utilization of a client base
Communication: \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management Demonstrate an energetic and positive attitude, strong communication and interpersonal skills. \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0Other skills: \xc2\xa0Embraces change in technology \xe2\x80\x93 Tech savvy, mobile and new media awareness. Enthusiastic, friendly, positive energy. Exceptional ability to develop relationships solves problems, use good judgment and influence customers/co-workers. Proven ability to set and achieve goals. Must enjoy working with people in a team environment\xc2\xa0Work Hours:\xc2\xa0Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include mornings, evenings, weekends and holiday\xe2\x80\x99s
\xc2\xa0'

OVERVIEW:\xc2\xa0 
The Barista sells and creates Starbucks coffee beverages following Starbucks standards providing outstanding customer service through product knowledge.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Demonstrate current and working knowledge of drip coffee, cold beverage, espresso bar, and pastry stations
Follows company standards and maintains work area and equipment in accordance with Health Department standards
Follows Starbucks Simply Service Steps and STAR skills providing an outstanding customer experience
Educate, sample, and serve customers products
Follows station specific duties and responsibilities
Opens and/or closes area following appropriate checklist, verifies completion with Manager on Duty prior to leaving the area
Maintains PAR stock levels and standards in product presentations
Produce and present freshly prepared products following Starbucks recipes while meeting speed of service standards
Follows Starbucks merchandising and signing standards
Maintain personal hygiene and professional dress code to comply with company, Starbucks, and Health Department standards
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 No specific educational accomplishment is necessary.\xc2\xa0 Previous restaurant/hospitality experience is preferred but not required\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 
Communication Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.\xc2\xa0
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.\xc2\xa0
Physical Demands:\xc2\xa0 This position involves constant moving and standing.\xc2\xa0 Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Involves lifting at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally involve reaching, stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders.\xc2\xa0 May involve reaching above eye level. Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.\xc2\xa0
Other skills:\xc2\xa0 Must be able to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Work Hours:\xc2\xa0 Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays.'

OVERVIEW:\xc2\xa0
The Bartender\xe2\x80\x99s primary responsibility is to provide outstanding customer service in a full-service restaurant environment by preparing and serving alcoholic beverages according to company, Health Department, and State and Federal regulations.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Adhere to company policy and State and Federal regulations regarding service of alcohol including taking all steps necessary to ensure proper age of all persons consuming alcohol served on the premises and refusing to serve any person who appears to be intoxicated or might become intoxicated from consuming additional alcohol
Follows Food Division Standards and Best Practices
Follow food safety standards and maintain work area and equipment in accordance with Health Department standards
Prepare and present all beverages following recipes and merchandising standards
Demonstrate MAGIC selling skills
Possess a strong working knowledge of wine, beer, and the varieties of alcohol
Educate, sample, and serve customers food and beverage
Effectively deal with multiple customers and communicate customer requests or concerns to other servers and manager on duty
Account for all product served by balancing and recording all sales, turning in accountability forms, charge slips, and cash to manager
Effectively operate POS system to ring in customer orders and control the flow of cash
Open and close area following appropriate checklist, verifying completion with Manager on Duty prior to leaving the area
Follow station specific duties and responsibilities
Maintain stock levels and standards in product presentation
Maintain personal hygiene and professional dress code to comply with company and Health Department standards
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Must be at least 21 years old to serve alcohol.\xc2\xa0 Previous restaurant/hospitality experience is preferred but not required.\xc2\xa0 Bartending certifications and training are preferred\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Communication Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety\xc2\xa0rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands:\xc2\xa0 This position involves constant moving and standing.\xc2\xa0 Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Involves lifting at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally involve reaching, stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders.\xc2\xa0 May involve reaching above eye level. Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0 Must possess excellent customer service skills.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours: Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays.'

OVERVIEW:\xc2\xa0 
The Cooking Demonstrator assumes responsibility for providing superior food products and maintaining a safe, efficient, professional, sanitary and profitable kitchen operation.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Ensure team prepares and presents food products following recipes and company standards
Monitor food quality by completing line checks throughout the day
Maintain a strong working relationship with store management
Provide culinary and food production training on an on-going basis to associates
Provide ongoing coaching and recognition to increase team\xe2\x80\x99s performance
Provide education to staff on new products and menus

Schedule and complete weekly payroll to maximize associate productivity, labor cost control and customer satisfaction
Utilize forecasts, daily sales reports and weekly food cost and payroll reports to ensure monthly profit/loss goals are met
Assist with ordering of food, beverage, dry and paper goods based budget and needs of the business
Review and ensure timely payment of invoices according to vendor contracts
Maintain food cost goal by proper purchasing, production, waste control, storage, product handling, rotation and inventory
Conduct food inventories to ensure they are taken on a timely and accurate basis to maintain targeted food and liquor costs
Responsible for the coordination and execution of special events and corporate-driven promotional strategies
Maintain role model standards in grooming and professional appearance and communications
Meet highest standards of workplace sanitation/equipment care and safety as set by Health Department and company policy
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 At least five years of food service experience is required.\xc2\xa0 At least one year of supervisory experience is required.\xc2\xa0 College degree, culinary degree or equivalent experience.\xc2\xa0 Certification in sanitation and safe food handling practices are preferred.
Communication Skills: Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability: Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands: This position involves constant moving and standing.\xc2\xa0 Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Involves lifting at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally involve reaching, stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders.\xc2\xa0 May involve reaching above eye level. Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.
Other skills: Must be able to operate standard kitchen equipment safely and efficiently.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to delegate tasks.\xc2\xa0 Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
Job Overview: \xc2\xa0
As a Floor Recovery Associate at Macy's, you will be a critical link in ensuring that our customers have a rewarding experience that will keep them coming back time after time. You will be required to move between selling areas as directed to maintain high customer readiness standards. You will deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment, while building quality customer relationships that result in increased sales and repeat business. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to demonstrating MAGIC Selling Skills and other operational tasks as assigned. This position is only in our Extreme Hard Shop Locations. Performs other duties as assigned.
Seasonal recovery associates perform the same tasks and functions as a regular associate in the same role, but for a temporary period of time, typically through December 26, although some positions may work a few weeks longer.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Essential Functions:

Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through the heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration
Drive sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling Skills
Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority
Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer in making the best choice
Demonstrate a professional, can-do attitude
Maintain high customer readiness standards: deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment
Recover merchandise from fitting rooms
Assist in replenishment of stock onto the sales floor
Participate in selling floor and stockroom maintenance and organization
Be sensitive to store\xe2\x80\x99s business needs and flex into other areas as needed
Maintain communication with Store Team, for support on driving sales, promos, and product knowledge Adhere to all safety and security policies and procedures
Ensure shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0
Qualifications:

Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management.
Other Skills: Ability to work as part of a team, or independently with minimal direct supervision.Strong customer selling orientation. Demonstrates a customer-first mentality. Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities and open to learning new procedures.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires heavy lifting and constant moving and standing
Work Hours: Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including evenings and weekends

Macy's is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment."

OVERVIEW:
The usage of RFID technology allows for faster and more frequent inventory counts to ensure inventory accuracy. The RFID associate will be responsible for utilizing this technology to help improve replenishment to ensure we have what the customer wants in stock and to drive sales.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Maintain customer service as the top priority
Project a courteous and professional demeanor to all internal and external customers
Re-ticket any items that are missing RFID tags or if information on the tag is incorrect
Act as scan leader for both the prep and cycle count process
Ensure the monthly cycle count is executed according to stores Best Practice guidelines, in all identified zones.
Assist in reconciliation following submission of cycle count, if necessary
Work with stores team in maintaining reserve areas
Monitor RFID audit process
Help in training support associates on all RFID functions
Answer any questions sales/support associates might have about the RFID process as needed
Be sensitive to the needs of the store and flex into other non-selling areas as needed
Ensure that shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Perform other duties as needed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: High School degree or equivalent. Minimum 1 year previous merchandising or retail operations experience. Exceptional customer service skills.
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires heavy lifting and constant moving and standing. Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours. Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs. May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders. May have to reach above eye level
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to train, assist and advise associates. Ability to delegate and follow through on projects in a timely manner. \xc2\xa0Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays.'

Description:

As a Gift Registry Advisor, you will be an integral part of bringing the magic of Macy's to life. Gift Registry Advisors are Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Home Lifestyle/Gift Registry Experts who provide personalized service through direct selling, product expertise and the use of social media tools with couples, gift givers and customers. \xc2\xa0Gift Registry Advisors are essential partners in creating a unique experience that will make customers feel welcome and comfortable.
As a Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Gift Registry Advisor, you are responsible for driving Stores Own Sales by:\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0Advising couples on creating an Omni-Channel Macy\xe2\x80\x99s gift registry that reflects their personal lifestyle utilizing the latest technology, whether they begin in-store or online
Offering personalized service to the couple, their parents, relatives, gift givers and home store customers\xc2\xa0
Assisting the couple when completing their registry and other post occasion needs as newlyweds\xc2\xa0
Building partnerships with the selling associates while acting as a home store expert consistently demonstrating MAGIC selling behaviors
Performs other duties as assigned.

\xc2\xa0Key Accountabilites:\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0Drive and exceed registry and home store sales goals by executing Stores Own Sales through MAGIC selling and aggressive and effective use of available and emerging technology\xc2\xa0
Deliver quality registries effectively leveraging all existing, new and emerging gift registry and Omni-Channel tools and technologies and social media tools\xc2\xa0
Contribute to overall home sales by actively working with couples, gift givers and customers as the Home Lifestyle/Gift Registry expert. Demonstrates effective and efficient use of tablet and mobile / smart phone technologies to recommend product /drive sales.
Mentor soft home selling associates on how to best serve the couple and their guests. Provide training to ensure the couple\xe2\x80\x99s unique bar code is captured for all WGR purchases.\xc2\xa0
Share product features/benefits with registering couples by understanding, using, and promoting vendor QR codes, on-line reviews and social media apps (i.e. Pinterest, Instagram, Facebook Widgets, etc.) as well as other new and emerging apps and tools.\xc2\xa0
Introduces the couples to their Macy\xe2\x80\x99s (total store) showcasing the areas relevant to their upcoming occasion as well as future needs (i.e. furniture, children\xe2\x80\x99s, etc.)
Develop quality relationships with our couples by making the registration process fun and rewarding. Clearly and concisely explain on-line and registry benefits including Dream Fund, with focus on the Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Wedding & Gift Registry (WGR) loyalty program.\xc2\xa0
Drive clienteling to deliver incremental sales throughout the couple\xe2\x80\x99s registry and newlywed period and during our six major WGR events.
Drive additional registrations through couple referrals, industry and social networking resources, community contacts (ie, bakeries, hotels, etc.) and external/internal events.
Assist registering couples in developing their desired personal style for their new home through product knowledge and promoting all Families of Business (FOB\xe2\x80\x99s) including furniture in the home store.
Participate in on-going product knowledge training through the utilization of product knowledge materials & resources (H.O.T)., review of product binders, vendor resources, webinars, Focus on 4 (Customer Service Score), in-store training sessions and networking with Home managers and associates.
Must have current, extensive and detailed product knowledge in all home FOB\xe2\x80\x99s with the ability to train home store associates.\xc2\xa0

\xc2\xa0Required Qualities:

\xc2\xa0Has \xe2\x80\x9cresults matter\xe2\x80\x9d drive and excellent follow-through; must be extremely detail oriented\xc2\xa0
Takes ownership role for achieving goals\xc2\xa0
Asks the right questions to discover couple\xe2\x80\x99s personal needs (understands what is important to fit the couple\xe2\x80\x99s lifestyle)\xc2\xa0
Is an engaging conversationalist and active listener; uses knowledge through conversation to suggest best products\xc2\xa0
Has ability to drive additional business through partnerships with industry experts and community contacts
Bonds with the couple as a trusted friend/advisor\xc2\xa0
Promotes private label and vendor brands and products; is knowledgeable about brand and product attributes
Demonstrates understanding (1) of the importance of the Omni-Channel customer and (2) that effective use of social media and current and emerging technologies is critical to driving business results
Is eager to learn and share knowledge with coworkers and associates
Understands and keeps current with all technology (both hardware and software) used by WGR and Omni-Channel customers
Ability to handle physical requirements to accomplish daily responsibilities

\xc2\xa0Skills Summary:\xc2\xa0

Retail or sales experience in customer service focused business; 2-4 years experience preferred
Passion for developing and maintaining home product knowledge (tabletop, housewares, textiles, luggage, big ticket)\xc2\xa0
Proficiency with computers, tablets, and smart phones and associated apps, programs and social media tools with interest in and ability to quickly learn new technology skills\xc2\xa0
Fully understands registry systems and all job related systems including FedFil, Esend and Search & Send
Ability to develop clientele in person and through the utilization of technology
Ability to plan, anticipate and develop solutions to ensure the most outstanding registry experience
Keen interest in life-styling and home fashion trends as it relates to our registering couples pre and post occasion
Must be able to work a four-week fixed rotating retail schedule including days, evenings and weekends.

\xc2\xa0
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of\xc2\xa0SFPC Art. 49."

OVERVIEW:
The Restaurant Supervisor supports the Restaurant Manager in running an efficient, professional, safe, and profitable food operation.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Follows and ensure team follows Food Division Standards and Best Practices
Responsible for daily operations
Accountable for sales, expenses, and bottom-line profits
Ensure team prepares and presents products following Food Division standards
Follows Macy\xe2\x80\x99s merchandising, product presentations and signing standards
Monitor food quality by completing A.M. and P.M. Line Checks
Demonstrate a positive role model for Magic Selling
Support a strong working relationship with store management
Provide on-going training, feedback, coaching, and staff motivation to all associates to maximize team performance and satisfaction
Maintain role model standards in grooming, professional appearance and communications
Meet highest standards of workplace safety, sanitation, and equipment care as set by Health Department and company policy
Complete scheduling and weekly payroll to maximize associate productivity, labor cost control and customer satisfaction
Utilize forecasts, daily sales reports and weekly food cost and payroll reports to ensure monthly profit/loss goals are met
Assist in preparation and production of all menu items
Assist in ordering and receiving food, beverage, dry and paper goods based budget and needs of the business
Completes timely payment of invoices according to vendor contracts and Food Division Best Practices
Responsible for food inventories following Inventory Best Practices to ensure they are taken on a timely and accurate basis to ensure targeted food and liquor costs are maintained
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 At least three years of food service experience is required.\xc2\xa0 Previous supervisory experience is preferred but not required.\xc2\xa0 College degree in a related field or equivalent experience is preferred.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Communication Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety\xc2\xa0rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.\xc2\xa0
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.\xc2\xa0
Physical Demands:\xc2\xa0 Extended periods of standing in areas of high heat are involved.\xc2\xa0 Some kneeling, stooping, crouching, or crawling may be involved.\xc2\xa0 Involving moving and/or lifting at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.\xc2\xa0 Involves working in close quarters. Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.\xc2\xa0
Other skills:\xc2\xa0 Must possess excellent customer service skills.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to delegate tasks. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
\xc2\xa0
Work Hours:\xc2\xa0 Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays.'

\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Handle all returns courteously and professionally
Develop a high level of product knowledge for the merchandise in the department by reading vendor tags, pamphlets, and attending training classes in order to communicate it to the customer
Suggest additional merchandise to compliment customer selection and engage the customer
Offer to call other locations if merchandise is unavailable within store
Offer to put purchase on customer\xe2\x80\x99s Macy\xe2\x80\x99s charge account toward the end of the shopping experience
Reinforce customer\xe2\x80\x99s selection and package merchandise with care
Invite customers to come back and thank them by name whenever possible
Responsible for achieving personal sales goals, hourly sales productivity rates, and Star Reward goals
Maintain a professional attitude with sincerity and enthusiasm reflecting Macy\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to our customer-the most important person in our stores
Develop clientele customer list and increase department sales
Follow up on purchases through e-mails, phone calls, or thank you cards
Cross sell throughout the store to maximize customer satisfaction and store sales
Complete support tasks such as recovering the fitting rooms and straightening merchandise as needed
Be proficient in POS and MPOS systems including Search and Send, My Client and More@ Macy\xe2\x80\x99s tablet app
Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper.
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
Be aware of back stock and fill as needed
Be aware of current promotional events and sales
Assist sales manager or vendors with special events as needed
Maintain good housekeeping standards
Adhere to Loss Prevention and inventory control and compliance procedures
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS:

Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.\xc2\xa0 Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands: This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing.\xc2\xa0 Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Involves lifting at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders.\xc2\xa0 Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. OVERVIEW:\xc2\xa0 
The AST\xe2\x80\x99s primary responsibilities are to organize the Store Management Office, execute operational administrative functions, oversee scheduling maintenance, balance the vault and other cash functions daily, distribute reports from My Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Portal to management team, facilitate the screening/hiring process, handle HR functions, and act as the HR liaison for store employees.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Coordinate distribution of all incoming communications (including faxes, e-mails, memos, letters, newsletters, and phone calls) whether from customers, employees, management, or the general public
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Maintain a professional attitude with sincerity and enthusiasm reflecting Macy\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to our customer
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Coordinate all functions of the hiring process including prescreening applicants, correspondence with applicants, and scheduling interviews with store management
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Balance vault and store checkbook and perform other cash functions on a daily basis
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Complete weekly store newsletter, maintain store bulletin board program, and organize store recognition allies
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Implement store Safety program and handle incident reporting process
\xc2\xb7\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Input employment data in the Job Requisition System and handle all new hire paperwork, orientation, and training sessions

Title: b'Administrative Support Team (AST) Associate:'

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
OVERVIEW:\xc2\xa0
The Furniture Sales/Design Associate is responsible for providing outstanding customer service by demonstrating advanced product knowledge and building quality client relationships in order to increase sales volume and repeat business.\xc2\xa0 Additionally, the associate is responsible for ensuring design solutions and educating clients through furniture consultations whether in the store or at the client\xe2\x80\x99s home.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Be proficient in POS and MPOS systems including Search and Send, My Client and More@ Macy\xe2\x80\x99s tablet app
Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper
Give outstanding customer service to clients by providing house calls, project management, floor planning, and hourly fee consultation when requested by clients
Actively build and maintain clientele file, through on-going self-marketing and external clientele including requesting referrals from existing clients, soliciting new clients through outside business relationships, and keeping detailed records of client purchases and future needs to build business
Achieve sales and credit solicitation goals while displaying prompt, courteous, knowledgeable, and professional customer service
Maintain and develop individual partnerships with design markets and other industry support
Maintain knowledge of special order vendor catalogues and work confidently with special order resources
Make 30-day check-in calls to keep clients informed on the status of their orders and to assess product satisfaction
Follow-up with thank you notes upon placing orders
Provide comprehensive floor plans with each project to allow client to fully understand proposed design
Provide warranty, care, upkeep, and delivery information to clients
Take returns back willingly and turn them into exchanges/sales when possible
Proactively develop a self-marketing plan
Take ownership in the department\xe2\x80\x99s readiness for business including resource upkeep, floor moves, set-up and takedown of signs, and tagging
Communicate with managers regarding customer service, sales, and inventory issues
Attend interior design sessions and seminars to keep up with changing professional criteria
Demonstrate high sales ethics standards
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Title: b'Big Ticket Interior Design Associate:'

Description:

OVERVIEW:\xc2\xa0 
The Selling Floor Leader\xe2\x80\x99s major responsibility is to ensure that the store\xe2\x80\x99s closing process goes smoothly.\xc2\xa0 Additionally, the Selling Floor Leader is responsible for maximizing sales and profits through the development of a quality sales organization and appropriate merchandise content within an area of the store.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
\xc2\xa0

Ensure store closing process goes smoothly and recover store to floor readiness standards
Maintain a consistent, high level of customer service within an area by participating in training and evaluation of associates\xe2\x80\x99 selling performance
Use computer system to monitor sales results for the area and maintain awareness of the area\xe2\x80\x99s business
Ensure all procedures, policies, and standards are understood and followed by associates
Manage the tools used to create professional selling standards, including client books, product knowledge material, selling techniques, and point of sale system
Understand the effects of staffing decisions and provide feedback to Selling Manager on the quality and volume of staffing to enhance levels of customer service
Maintain acceptable presentation standards on the selling floor through proper utilization of visual displays and merchandise content
Manage adherence to Merchandise Availability Protection Standards (MAP) and maintain a high level of associate awareness regarding shortage
Coordinate and execute physical inventory process for area
Execute timely markdowns and clearance sale event set ups
Be knowledgeable of POS policies and procedures and be able to train and coach associates on the POS functions
Review advertising calendar and maintain floor presentation to maximize sales opportunities
Build enthusiasm and awareness of promotional events amongst selling staff
Review business driving opportunities with management and coordinate implementation within area
Communicate information from buyers, vendors, and planners on product knowledge and merchandise presentation to the selling team build awareness of customer requests regarding merchandise mix
Maintain contact with all levels of management at the store level to obtain direction and support
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Be proficient in POS and MPOS systems including Search and Send, My Client and More@ Macy\xe2\x80\x99s tablet app
Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 High School Diploma or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 Minimum of one to five years\xe2\x80\x99 experience in retail sales is preferred.
Communication Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.

Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.
Other skills:\xc2\xa0 Superior organizational and time management skills.\xc2\xa0 Able to delegate tasks. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours:\xc2\xa0 Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays.

OVERVIEW:\xc2\xa0 
The Visual Merchandiser is responsible for arranging and maintaining attractive visual presentation in windows, on ledges, shelves, and fashion panels throughout the store.\xc2\xa0 May follow a floor plan to re-merchandise an area in preparation for special events or season changes.
\xc2\xa0

Set-up and maintain fixtures using hand or power tools, such as saws, dykes, hammers, screwdrivers, staple guns, ladders, mannequin units, scissors, nails, spray paint, spray glue, and knives
Maintain and present visual displays in a compelling and exciting manner in accordance with company directives
Understand customer preferences and exercise judgment when deviating from company directives to appeal to specific customer base
Maintain window displays and mannequin presentation
Implement store signing programs
Continuously check selling floor for proper merchandise presentation and general housekeeping, repairs, cleaning, and straightening of merchandise as needed
Accessorize mannequins and displays using items such as shoes, jewelry, perfume, props, lamps, and area rugs
Follow safety standards at all times
Maintain organization and cleanliness of visual presentation workroom
Keep track of prop inventory and report discrepancies to Visual Merchandise Manager or appropriate personnel

Title: b'Vendor Stock Support:'

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
OVERVIEW: \xc2\xa0
As an Optimal Fitting Room andSelling Floor Support Lead, you will be an integral part of bringing the magic of Macy's to life by directing the fitting room recovery process in your location. You are responsible to direct, monitor and communicate with Optimal Fitting Room and Selling Floor Support associates, and coordinate with the Executive in Charge (EIC) or designated Sales Manager regarding assignment/movement of teams based on fitting room needs.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Lead, monitor, and direct the fitting room recovery process; participate in all functions of fitting room maintenance as needed
Partner with Receiving Team Manager/Lead on sortation hub location and merchandise movement equipment as needed
Set sortation hub with equipment prior to the start of the fitting room recovery shift, and monitor throughout
Check each fitting room stall to ensure that it is free of merchandise, and place merchandise on fitting room racks
Collect and transport unsorted fitting room racks to the designated sortation hub
Sort merchandise on collected racks in designated sortation hub by vendor and family of business, ensuring that merchandise is floor-ready
Transport sorted racks from sortation hub back to the selling floor for placement
Return sorted merchandise to the correct fixtures on the selling floor per merchandising guidelines
Communicate with the Executive in Charge (EIC) regarding the efficient execution of the fitting room recovery process
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality
Perform other duties as needed

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0 High School Diploma or equivalent.\xc2\xa0 Minimum of one to three years experience in a supervisory position.\xc2\xa0 Additional schooling or background in merchandising is preferred.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0 Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills\xc2\xa0
Mathematical Skills:\xc2\xa0 Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability:\xc2\xa0 Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands:\xc2\xa0 This position requires constant moving and standing.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours.\xc2\xa0 Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs.\xc2\xa0 May occasionally be required to reach, stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders.\xc2\xa0 May have to reach above eye level. Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.
Other skills:\xc2\xa0 Strong merchandising skills.\xc2\xa0 Possess vision and creativity.\xc2\xa0 Superior organizational skills. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.\xc2\xa0 Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0
Work Hours:\xc2\xa0 Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays."

Title: b'Optimal Fitting Room Associate:'

Description:
b'(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
OVERVIEW: \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
As a Meal and Break Coverage Sales Associate at Macy's, you will be a critical link in ensuring that our customers have a rewarding experience that will keep them coming back time after time. This associate\xe2\x80\x99s primary responsibility is to serve and connect with customers to determine the best way in which to address their needs. By moving between selling areas as directed to ensure appropriate coverage, you will build quality customer relationships that result in increased sales and repeat business. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to demonstrating MAGIC Selling Skills and meeting Stars Rewards credit program standards.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Drive top line sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling Skills and Behaviors.
Make the connection with the customer, acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner upon entry into the department
Drive sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling skills, leveraging technology to optimize inventories across all channels and provide a relevant, seamless and fun one to one customer experience
Be proficient in POS and MPOS systems including Search and Send, My Client and More@Macy\xe2\x80\x99s tablet app
Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper.
Assist the customer in the selection process, by utilizing your expert selling skills and product knowledge
Maintain constant communication and contact with the customer from the selection process to the closing of the transaction at the POS.
Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority
Enjoy meeting and interacting with customers
Demonstrate an enthusiastic and positive attitude
Maintain current product knowledge to best assist in customer sales for the area assigned
Maintain high customer readiness standards: deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment
Handle returns graciously, always saying "yes" and partnering with a Manager when judgments need to be made
Teamwork oriented with the ability to work in a learning environment
Maintain recovery and special departmental operating procedures
Attend to customer service needs in a friendly and helpful manner when approached
Process fulfillment orders to include; locating and picking merchandise for customer orders
Makes sure all picked merchandise is delivered to the send area for the receiving team to pack and ship
Follows shortage programs and procedures as they pertain to the merchandising function
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, and flex between areas of the store and fulfillment functions, as directed by the Supervisor and/or Lead
Be sensitive to store\xe2\x80\x99s needs and flex into other non-selling areas as needed
Ensure that shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Perform other duties as needed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0
QUALIFICATIONS
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0 High School degree or equivalent. Minimum 1 year previous retail experience.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0A bility to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Self-starter, able to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves heavy lifting and constant moving and standing. Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours. Involves lifting at least 30 lbs. May occasionally be involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. May involve reaching above eye level
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Should \xc2\xa0be comfortable with the \xc2\xa0use of computers \xc2\xa0and frequent \xc2\xa0use of \xc2\xa0RF \xc2\xa0equipment. Proficient in POS transactions and is adaptable to new technology

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner within 30 seconds of their entry into the area
Handle all returns courteously and professionally
Flex into other departments to sell as needed
Demonstrate broad knowledge of store products and services to build sales and minimize returns
Suggest additional merchandise to compliment customer selection

Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

OVERVIEW: \xc2\xa0
The Freelance Associate is responsible for arranging and maintaining attractive visual presentation in windows, on ledges, shelves, and fashion panels throughout the store. \xc2\xa0The Visual Associate is responsible for constructing large and complex visual displays and special visual projects. \xc2\xa0May follow a floor plan to re-merchandise an area in preparation for special events or season changes.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Pull merchandise to set-up visual representations using the loan book to check merchandise into and out of departments
Work on special and complex projects as assigned by Visual Merchandising Manager
Construct, paint, set-up, and install signs, sale banners, panels, and other items required for special events, clearance events, and fashion shows
Set-up and maintain fixtures using hand or power tools, such as saws, dykes, hammers, screwdrivers, staple guns, ladders, mannequin units, scissors, nails, spray paint, spray glue, and knives
Maintain and present complicated visual displays in a compelling and exciting manner in accordance with company directives\xc2\xa0
Understand customer preferences and exercise judgment when deviating from company directives to appeal to specific customer base
Maintain window displays and mannequin presentation
Implement store signing programs
Accessorize mannequins and displays using items such as shoes, jewelry, perfume, props, lamps, and area rugs
Follow safety standards at all times
Maintain organization and cleanliness of visual presentation workroom
Keep track of prop inventory and report discrepancies to Visual Merchandise Manager or appropriate personnel
Execute promotional calendar
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures\xc2\xa0
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor\xc2\xa0
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: High School Diploma or equivalent. \xc2\xa0Additional education training in art or merchandising is preferred. \xc2\xa0At least two years experience in a visual related role. \xc2\xa0Merchandise presentation or visual presentation experience is preferred.
Communication Skills: Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability: Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands: This position involves heavy lifting, constant moving, standing and reaching with arms and hands. \xc2\xa0Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours, lifting at least 30 lbs, stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. \xc2\xa0May involve reaching above eye level. Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.
Other skills: Must possess vision and creativity. \xc2\xa0Basic knowledge of art, design, fashion, and interior decoration. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team. \xc2\xa0Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours: Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays.

The Vendor Paid Private Brand Specialist is responsible for providing outstanding customer service, meeting hourly sales and Star Rewards goals on a personal and departmental basis, demonstrating superior product knowledge to customers, and creating a shopping experience that will make the customer feel welcome and comfortable.\xc2\xa0 Additionally, the Vendor Paid Private Brand Specialist is responsible for becoming an expert on the vendor\xe2\x80\x99s product and promoting brand loyalty.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Handle all returns courteously and professionally

Offer to put purchase on customer\xe2\x80\x99s Macy\xe2\x80\x99s charge account toward the end of the shopping experience

Maintain communication with vendors, MTMs, and regional and district offices for support on driving sales, promos, and product knowledge
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
Be aware of back stock and fill as needed
Be aware of current promotional events and sales

Adhere to Loss Prevention and inventory control and compliance procedures
Be proficient in POS and MPOS systems including Search and Send, My Client and More@ Macy\xe2\x80\x99s tablet app
Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper.

Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

The Impulse Trendsetter is an exceptional Sales Associate who utilizes product knowledge and superior selling skills to drive sales.
