Title: b'IMPULSE Trendsetter:'

Description:
b'With Macy\xe2\x80\x99s you have flexibility and ownership of your schedule! \xc2\xa0 \xc2\xa0The details unique to each option are detailed below; be certain to scroll down to see the details that apply to all options. \xc2\xa0
Option 1\xe2\x80\x93 Typically assigned 35-40 hours/5 days a week; includes 2 assigned late shifts per week and availability most weekends (including Friday evening).
Option 2 \xe2\x80\x93 Typically assigned 28-32 hours/4 days a week; includes 2 assigned late shifts per week and availability most weekends (including Friday evening). \xc2\xa0You may pick up additional available shifts.
Option 3 \xe2\x80\x93 Typically assigned 20-30 hours/up to 4 days a week; includes up to 2 assigned late shifts per week and availability on most weekends (including Friday evening). \xc2\xa0You may pick up additional available shifts.
Option 4 \xe2\x80\x93 Typically assigned 12-20 hours/up to 4 days per week; most shifts will be assigned after 6 p.m. \xc2\xa0You may pick up additional shifts, and availability on some weekends (including Friday evening) is required.
Option 5 \xe2\x80\x93 Assigned 3-8 hours/up to 2 days per week; most shifts will begin after 6:00 p.m. \xc2\xa0You may pick up additional available shifts, and availability on most weekends (including Friday evening) is required.
Option 6 \xe2\x80\x93 You will pick up all of your shifts, and must work at least one shift every 14 days or less to maintain active employment\xc2\xa0
Managing Your Schedule:

Associates are responsible for insuring they are scheduled sufficient hours either through assigned or pick up hours to achieve and maintain their full time or part time status, benefits (at least 32 average hours paid per quarter to maintain FT benefits; 20 hours for PT benefits), and other requirements.


Options 1 through 3 require availability on most weekends (including Friday evenings) and key dates. \xc2\xa0Options 4 through 6 require some availability on some weekends (including Friday evenings) and key dates.


You may select up to three (3) days per month that you are not available to work; two of those days may be used consecutively and on Saturday and Sunday (this is not applicable to Option 6). \xc2\xa0Options 1 and 2 have additional morning and evening shift selection preferences.


Preferred Availability allows you to customize assigned shifts to fit your lifestyle, and you can change your scheduling option and Preferred Availability during the semi-annual selection window. \xc2\xa0All associates are required to select preferences for Saturday and Sunday.


Temporary Availability allows you to limit or open up your availability, and plan ahead for time off by using \xe2\x80\x9cunavailable days\xe2\x80\x9d or Attendance Credits (Full Time and Part Time associates may also use Paid Time Off). \xc2\xa0


You can view your schedule no later than the Friday nine (9) days before the work week. \xc2\xa0The published schedule includes assigned shifts and any planning ahead activity you\xe2\x80\x99ve completed.


Your schedule generally will not be changed once shifts are published; you typically must use self-service tools to make any adjustments to your assigned shifts.

Please note: \xc2\xa0In California, Nevada, and Puerto Rico, shifts are generally no more than 7.75 hours in a day with a maximum of 39 hours in a work week.
\xc2\xa0'
Title: b'Schedule Option Detail '

Description:
b"To return to the job overview, please click your browser back button.
As a Loss Prevention Seasonal Security Guard, you will be an integral part of bringing the magic of Macy's to life. \xc2\xa0Seasonal Seasonal Security Guard \xc2\xa0work as part of a team to meet department and store objectives, and your individual responsibilities will include deterring theft and maintaining a safe business environment. \xc2\xa0 Seasonal \xc2\xa0Security Guard will have work schedules that can flex and may include working early mornings, late evenings, weekends, and holidays
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Visually monitor customer traffic entering and exiting the store
Communicate suspicious activity to Loss Prevention
Provide exceptional customer service by ensuring that customers do not leave with a security tag on their purchases\xc2\xa0
May perform audit functions in high shortage areas\xc2\xa0
Promptly prepare professional and complete reports relative to all theft incidents, merchandise recoveries, accident investigations, audits, and other activities as assigned by the Loss Prevention Manager\xc2\xa0
Have knowledge of and maintain strict compliance with company policies
Must be able to work Thanksgiving Day (11/27), the day after Thanksgiving (11/28), Saturday after Thanksgiving (11/29) and December 14th \xc2\xa0thru December 24th \xc2\xa0
Perform other duties as assigned
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0
Education/Experience - High School degree or equivalent. Complete all Seasonal Security training requirements Prior retail loss prevention experience preferred but not required.\xc2\xa0
Communication Skills - Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as reports and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.\xc2\xa0
Mathematical Skills - Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability - Ability to adapt to possible stressful and hostile situations. Ability to remain calm under pressure and exhibit good judgment
Physical Demands - This position involves regular walking, standing, hearing, and talking. Extended periods of standing are also involved. Some kneeling, stooping, crouching, or crawling may be involved. Ability to move and/or lift at least 30 lbs. Specific vision abilities involved include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
Other skills - Ability to interact with customers positively and in a friendly and accommodating manner. \xc2\xa0Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team.. Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Diplay consistent good judgement and decsision making skills.\xc2\xa0
Work Hours - Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include early morning, day, late evening, weekends, holidays, and major sales events based on department and store/company needs.
Work schedules may begin with minimal hours and will increase throughout the holiday season. \xc2\xa0
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
\xc2\xa0"
Title: b'Seasonal Security Guard:'

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
The Draw vs. Commission Sales Associate is responsible for providing outstanding customer service, meeting hourly sales and Star Rewards goals on a personal and departmental basis, and demonstrating superior product knowledge to customers. \xc2\xa0To create a shopping experience that will make the customer feel welcome and comfortable.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:

Acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner within 30 seconds of their entry into the area
Handle all returns courteously and professionally
Determine customer needs based on personal features and other customer preference related factors
Demonstrate knowledge of store products and services to build sales and minimize returns
Suggest additional merchandise to compliment customer selection
Offer to call other locations if merchandise is unavailable within store
Offer to put purchase on customer\xe2\x80\x99s Macy\xe2\x80\x99s charge account toward the end of the shopping experience
Reinforce customer\xe2\x80\x99s selection and package merchandise with care
Invite customers to come back and thank them by name whenever possible
Responsible for achieving personal sales goals and Star Reward goals
Maintain a professional attitude with sincerity and enthusiasm reflecting Macy\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to our customer-the most important person in our stores
Use clientele program to maintain customer profile and contact information to increase personal sales
Handle more difficult customer requests
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
Develop extensive product knowledge by reading current vendor tags and pamphlets
Attend additional training classes in order to communicate product benefits to the customer
Be aware of back stock and fill as needed
Be aware of current promotional events and sales
Maintain good housekeeping standards
Adhere to Loss Prevention and inventory control and compliance procedures
Perform other duties as needed

Job Specifications:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0No specific educational accomplishment is required. \xc2\xa0At least six months to one year of previous selling experience is required.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate with customers, peers, and management. \xc2\xa0Able to communicate on the telephone with proper etiquette.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator. \xc2\xa0Must be able to calculate percentages and ratios. \xc2\xa0Must be able to make change using American monetary units.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing. \xc2\xa0Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs. \xc2\xa0May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders. \xc2\xa0Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Must be able to function as part of a team. \xc2\xa0Possess a strong sense of urgency. \xc2\xa0Must enjoy meeting and interacting with customers. Possess a thirst for learning.
Working Conditions: \xc2\xa0Reasonable accommodations have been made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. \xc2\xa0Work generally occurs in a retail store environment with moderate temperature and noise level.
Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.\xc2\xa0
Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of SFPC Art. 49.
\xc2\xa0"

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
As a Stock Processing and Placement Associate, you will be an integral part of bringing the magic of Macy\xe2\x80\x99s to life. \xc2\xa0Associates in this role perform a number of functions that are critical to offering our customers the best experience when they shop in our store. While all positions require working as part of a team to meet department and store objectives, your individual responsibilities based on your position.Details on our two key support positions, the Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associate and the Retail Merchandise Placement Associate are listed below:
Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associate Overview:
Your individual responsibilities may include the timely execution of the receiving process, delivering merchandise to the floor for placement, ensuring floor readiness by store opening, keeping the selling floor stocked with merchandise, and organizing the selling floor and stock areas. Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associates may also assist with clearing out fitting rooms, recover the selling floor by folding and rehanging merchandise, and preparing merchandise for shipping to customers.
In order to present our customers with the best shopping experience, most of our Truck Processing and Handling Associates start their workday early in the morning or late in the evening to ensure we are ready to make Macy's magic. Some locations even have overnight processing schedules. Associates will have the opportunity to work a flexible schedule, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends and busy events such as the day after Thanksgiving and the day after Christmas.
Any scheduled hours listed in the job posting title are subject to change based on business needs. All associates may be required to work hours other than those stated in the job posting title on weekends or on key events, such as the Friday after Thanksgiving.
Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associate Essential Functions:

Unload and unpack new merchandise shipments, and prepare them for the selling floor by folding, hanging, or stacking
Deliver new merchandise to the appropriate department for placement on the selling floor or stock area
Organize and maintain merchandise in stockrooms, and fill in the selling floor as needed
Learn Macy's systems and procedures to enhance selling efficiencies and complete support duties
Collect damaged merchandise from designated areas and accurately complete required paperwork
Restock register wrapstand supplies and collect hangers
Assist with the pulling and preparation of merchandise for shipment to customers
Provide support for major sales events
Participate as needed in selling floor recovery, including folding and hanging merchandise and restocking the selling floor
Perform other duties as assigned
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Retail Truck Processing and Handling Associate Qualifications:
Education/Experience: No specific education or experience required
Communication Skills: Ability to read and interpret documents such as memos, safety rules, policies and procedures. Ability to communicate effectively with peers and management
Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities, and learn new procedures. Ability to work as part of a team, but also able to complete tasks independently with little supervision
Physical Demands: Position may include frequent lifting, bending, reaching, and the use of ladders and other equipment
Other Skills: Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude
Work Hours: Available to work a flexible schedule, which may include early morning, evening, overnight, weekends holidays, and major sales events. Hours are subject to change based on business needs
Retail Merchandise Placement Associate Overview:
Your individual responsibilities may include placement of new merchandise receipts on the selling floor, moving merchandise to prepare for sales events, pulling merchandise for shipping to customers, and completing price changes. Retail Merchandise Placement Associates may also assist with clearing out fitting rooms, recover the selling floor by folding and rehanging merchandise, and organizing the selling floor and stock areas.
In order to present our customers with the best shopping experience, most of our Merchandise Placement Associates start their workday early in the morning or late in the evening to ensure we are ready to make Macy's magic. Some locations even have overnight schedules. Associates will have the opportunity to work a flexible schedule, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends and busy events such as the day after Thanksgiving and the day after Christmas.\xc2\xa0
Any scheduled hours listed in the job posting title are subject to change based on business needs. All associates may be required to work hours other than those stated in the job posting title on weekends or on key holiday events, such as the Friday after Thanksgiving.
Retail Merchandise Placement Associate Essential Functions:

Placement of merchandise in the selling floor or stock area
Assist in price changing execution
Organize and maintain merchandise in stockrooms, and fill in the selling floor as needed
Learn Macy's systems and procedures to enhance selling efficiencies and complete support duties
Pull merchandise for online customers and deliver to the designated area on the Receiving Dock
Assist in the preparation of merchandise for shipment to customers
Provide support for major sales events
Participate as needed in selling floor recovery, including folding and hanging merchandise and clearing fitting rooms
Performs other duties as assigned
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Retail Merchandise Placement Associate Qualifications:
Education/Experience: No specific education or experience required
Communication Skills: Ability to read and interpret documents such as memos, safety rules, policies and procedures. Ability to communicate effectively with peers and management
Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability: Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities, and learn new procedures. Ability to work as part of a team, but also able to complete tasks independently with little supervision
Physical Demands: Position may include frequent lifting, up to 50 lbs., bending, reaching, and the use of ladders and other equipment
Other Skills: Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude
Work Hours: Available to work a flexible schedule, which may include early morning, evening, and weekends, holidays and major sales events. Hours subject to change based on business needs
Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.\xc2\xa0
Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of SFPC Art. 49.
\xc2\xa0"
Title: b'Retail Stock Processing/Placement Associate (San Francisco):'

Description:
b"(To return to the application, click your browser back button)
OVERVIEW:\xc2\xa0
As a Seasonal Interviewer, you will assist the HRM and AST in facilitating the Seasonal screening/hiring process and perform other duties as needed. Seasonal Interviewer must possess strong communication skills with the ability to make sound decisions.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Evaluate number of store interview timeslots vs. interview to hire ratios to ensure optimal efficiency.\xc2\xa0
Assist in coordinating the interview process for Store Management team.\xc2\xa0
Conduct majority of the store Seasonal interviewing.\xc2\xa0
Focus on screening, interviewing and selecting quality candidates.
Review daily open job report and reconcile discrepancies.\xc2\xa0
Help AST with administrative tasks for all new hire paperwork, outside of Online Forms.\xc2\xa0
Review weekly training compliance report and make corrections, as needed.\xc2\xa0
Monitor retention strategies to ensure execution to company standard in an effort to reduce turnover\xc2\xa0
Perform other duties as needed.
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor.\xc2\xa0
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality\xc2\xa0

QUALIFICATIONS:\xc2\xa0
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0External hires should have minimum of two years of administrative/and or HR experience. Internal candidates should possess leadership skills.\xc2\xa0
Communication Skills:\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0 Strong customer service orientation. Demonstrate ability to collaborate as a member of a team.\xc2\xa0
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving and standing. Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours. May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. May involve reaching above eye level.
Other Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to anticipate and solve problems, act decisively and persist in the face of obstacles.\xc2\xa0
Ability to delegate and follow through on projects in a timely manner. Highly organized, with the ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities. Outstanding leadership, interpersonal and communication skills. Effective prioritizing and time management skills. Should be comfortable with the use of computers.\xc2\xa0
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening and weekends.\xc2\xa0
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.\xc2\xa0
\xc2\xa0"

Title: b'Seasonal Interviewer/Trainer (San Francisco):'

Description:
b"(to return to the job overview, please click your browser back button)
As a Gift Registry Advisor, you will be an integral part of bringing the magic of Macy's to life. Gift Registry Advisors are Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Home Lifestyle/Gift Registry Experts who provide personalized service through direct selling, product expertise and the use of social media tools with couples, gift givers and customers. \xc2\xa0Gift Registry Advisors are essential partners in creating a unique experience that will make customers feel welcome and comfortable.
As a Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Gift Registry Advisor, you are responsible for driving Stores Own Sales by:\xc2\xa0

Advising couples on creating an Omni-Channel Macy\xe2\x80\x99s gift registry that reflects their personal lifestyle utilizing the latest technology, whether they begin in-store or online
Offering personalized service to the couple, their parents, relatives, gift givers and home store customers\xc2\xa0
Assisting the couple when completing their registry and other post occasion needs as newlyweds\xc2\xa0
Building partnerships with the selling associates while acting as a home store expert consistently demonstrating MAGIC selling behaviors
Performs other duties as assigned.

Key Accountabilites:\xc2\xa0

Drive and exceed registry and home store sales goals by executing Stores Own Sales through MAGIC selling and aggressive and effective use of available and emerging technology\xc2\xa0
Deliver quality registries effectively leveraging all existing, new and emerging gift registry and Omni-Channel tools and technologies and social media tools\xc2\xa0
Contribute to overall home sales by actively working with couples, gift givers and customers as the Home Lifestyle/Gift Registry expert. Demonstrates effective and efficient use of tablet and mobile / smart phone technologies to recommend product /drive sales.
Mentor soft home selling associates on how to best serve the couple and their guests. Provide training to ensure the couple\xe2\x80\x99s unique bar code is captured for all WGR purchases.\xc2\xa0
Share product features/benefits with registering couples by understanding, using, and promoting vendor QR codes, on-line reviews and social media apps (i.e. Pinterest, Instagram, Facebook Widgets, etc.) as well as other new and emerging apps and tools.\xc2\xa0
Introduces the couples to their Macy\xe2\x80\x99s (total store) showcasing the areas relevant to their upcoming occasion as well as future needs (i.e. furniture, children\xe2\x80\x99s, etc.)
Develop quality relationships with our couples by making the registration process fun and rewarding. Clearly and concisely explain on-line and registry benefits including Dream Fund, with focus on the Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Wedding & Gift Registry (WGR) loyalty program.\xc2\xa0
Drive clienteling to deliver incremental sales throughout the couple\xe2\x80\x99s registry and newlywed period and during our six major WGR events.
Drive additional registrations through couple referrals, industry and social networking resources, community contacts (ie, bakeries, hotels, etc.) and external/internal events.
Assist registering couples in developing their desired personal style for their new home through product knowledge and promoting all Families of Business (FOB\xe2\x80\x99s) including furniture in the home store.
Participate in on-going product knowledge training through the utilization of product knowledge materials & resources (H.O.T)., review of product binders, vendor resources, webinars, Focus on 4 (Customer Service Score), in-store training sessions and networking with Home managers and associates.
Must have current, extensive and detailed product knowledge in all home FOB\xe2\x80\x99s with the ability to train home store associates.\xc2\xa0

Required Qualities:

Has \xe2\x80\x9cresults matter\xe2\x80\x9d drive and excellent follow-through; must be extremely detail oriented\xc2\xa0
Takes ownership role for achieving goals\xc2\xa0
Asks the right questions to discover couple\xe2\x80\x99s personal needs (understands what is important to fit the couple\xe2\x80\x99s lifestyle)\xc2\xa0
Is an engaging conversationalist and active listener; uses knowledge through conversation to suggest best products\xc2\xa0
Has ability to drive additional business through partnerships with industry experts and community contacts
Bonds with the couple as a trusted friend/advisor\xc2\xa0
Promotes private label and vendor brands and products; is knowledgeable about brand and product attributes
Demonstrates understanding (1) of the importance of the Omni-Channel customer and (2) that effective use of social media and current and emerging technologies is critical to driving business results
Is eager to learn and share knowledge with coworkers and associates
Understands and keeps current with all technology (both hardware and software) used by WGR and Omni-Channel customers
Ability to handle physical requirements to accomplish daily responsibilities

Skills Summary:\xc2\xa0

Retail or sales experience in customer service focused business; 2-4 years experience preferred
Passion for developing and maintaining home product knowledge (tabletop, housewares, textiles, luggage, big ticket)\xc2\xa0
Proficiency with computers, tablets, and smart phones and associated apps, programs and social media tools with interest in and ability to quickly learn new technology skills\xc2\xa0
Fully understands registry systems and all job related systems including FedFil, Esend and Search & Send
Ability to develop clientele in person and through the utilization of technology
Ability to plan, anticipate and develop solutions to ensure the most outstanding registry experience
Keen interest in life-styling and home fashion trends as it relates to our registering couples pre and post occasion
Must be able to work a four-week fixed rotating retail schedule including days, evenings and weekends.

This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of SFPC Art. 49.
\xc2\xa0"
Title: b'Gift Registry Advisor (San Francisco):'

Description:
b"(To return to the job overview, please click your browser back button)
You will have the opportunity to help others look their best every day with a role in Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Cosmetics Department. You\xe2\x80\x99ll make one-on-one connections with customers to learn their sense of beauty and style, develop your artistic side though customer consultation and make-up and product application, and attain a sense of accomplishment when your selling skills combine with your passion for beauty to reach personal and team sales goals. Previous cosmetics experience is nice to have, but it is not required to begin a career in beauty at Macy\xe2\x80\x99s.
Seasonal associates perform the same tasks and functions as a regular associate in the same role, but for a temporary period of time, typically through December 26, although some positions may work a few weeks longer.
There are two key Cosmetic Department roles: \xc2\xa0Cosmetic Beauty Advisor and Cosmetic Counter Manager
Cosmetic Beauty Advisor Essential Functions

Initiate service consultations to determine the customer\xe2\x80\x99s preferences and buying/service needs; explain and demonstrate use of cosmetics through actual application
Partner with Sales Manager and Counter Manager to identify business driving opportunities and stock needs
Develop a repeat-business customer base in order to regularly communicate: upcoming events, new merchandise receipts and product replenishment to increase incremental sales
Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority
Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer in making the best choice
Attend product training classes and seminars
Achieve Scorecard and counter goals
Participate in pre-selling and sales driving events as well as processing of new receipts, damages, testers, and return to vendors (RTVs)\xc2\xa0
Maintain high customer readiness standards by ensuring proper presentation, organization, storing, and replenishment of stock as well as good housekeeping standards
Serve as Role Model/Mentor to new hires
Proficient in POS systems including Search and Send and My Client
Ensure safety and shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Perform other customer-facing duties as needed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Cosmetic Beauty Advisor Qualifications\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High school diploma or equivalent. \xc2\xa0Previous cosmetic or fragrance sales experience a plus
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret labels including warnings and ingredient lists on products. \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to customers, vendors, buyers, peers, and all levels of management
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator and calculate percentages and ratios. \xc2\xa0Must be able to make change in American monetary units
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, grabbing and also standing for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. \xc2\xa0Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. \xc2\xa0Involves lifting at least 40 lbs.
Other Skills: \xc2\xa0Superior organizational and time management skills. \xc2\xa0Must be able to build relationships and influence others. \xc2\xa0Ability to set and achieve goals. \xc2\xa0Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. \xc2\xa0Must possess a strong sense of urgency and a thirst for knowledge. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lead by example
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Ability to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, holidays, and sales events, based on department and store/company need

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0Cosmetic Counter Manager Essential Functions\xc2\xa0

Recruit, train, coach, motivate, and develop new and incumbent beauty advisors on company policies and procedures, product knowledge, and personal and department productivity goals
Role model expectations through initiating service consultations, sharing technique and product knowledge through actual application, and developing a repeat-business customer base
Sell merchandise through exceptional customer service techniques and professional selling skills to reach personal productivity goals
Develop and implement business-driving events and ensure proper execution to achieve counter productivity goals
Communicate productivity goals, monitor associate productivity levels, and provide coaching and feedback
Review and analyze business performance of daily, weekly, monthly, seasonal, and annual sales results
Supervise proper presentation, organization, storing, a replenishment of stock
Ensure timely processing of new receipts, damages, testers, and return to vendors (RTVs) through delegation to self and staff
Communicate regularly with vendors, planners, and buyers regarding stock needs, customer preferences, and special events
Attend product training classes and seminars
Participate in pre-selling and sales driving events
Maintain high customer readiness standards by ensuring proper presentation, organization, storing, and replenishment of stock as well as good housekeeping standards
Proficient in POS systems including Search and Send and My Client
Participate in physical inventory process
Ensure safety and shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Perform other customer-facing, duties as needed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Cosmetic Counter Manager Qualifications\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High school diploma or equivalent. \xc2\xa0A minimum of one year of previous selling experience required, preferably in Cosmetics. \xc2\xa0Previous supervisory experience preferred
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret general business reports and labels including warnings and ingredient lists on products. \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to customers, vendors, buyers, peers, and all levels of management
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator and calculate percentages and ratios. \xc2\xa0Must be able to make change in American monetary units
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Must be able to anticipate and solve problems
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, grabbing and standing for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0May occasionally involve to stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. \xc2\xa0Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. \xc2\xa0Involves lifting at least 40 lbs.
Other Skills: \xc2\xa0Superior organizational and time management skills. \xc2\xa0Must be able to build relationships and influence others. \xc2\xa0Ability to set and achieve goals. \xc2\xa0Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. \xc2\xa0Must possess a strong sense of urgency and a thirst for knowledge. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lead by example
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Ability to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, holidays, and sales events, based on department and store/company needs

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
The Support Team Associate is responsible for the Merchandising, Fulfillment and BOPS process as well as achieving sales plan by ensuring proper product placement and flow of new receipts. They create an enhanced shopping experience and support the selling process by leveraging relationship throughout the store in order to attend to the customer. Other operational duties include floor moves, replenishment, inventory; shortage control, stockroom organization, and merchandising.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Process merchandise to floor ready standards and assist the Support Team Lead with the placement of merchandise on the sales floor
Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper.
Communicate issues to Manager and or Merchandise Team Lead
Assist the Support Team Lead in the movement of fixtures and merchandise for new product, season changes, and clearance sets
Process fulfillment orders to include; locating and picking merchandise for customer orders
Assist in replenishing stock onto the sales floor
Assist in the inventory process
Assist in markdown process
Participate in stockroom maintenance, organization, and housekeeping
Process damages, transfers, and return to vendor merchandise
Maintain high customer readiness standards by delivering a clean, neat, easy to shop store environment
Follows shortage programs and procedures as they pertain to the merchandising function
Place product to appeal to customer preference
Attend to customer service needs in a friendly and helpful manner when approached
Be sensitive to the store\xe2\x80\x99s needs and flex into other non-selling areas as needed
Assist with special projects as assigned
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS

Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0No specific educational accomplishments are necessary.\xc2\xa0
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. \xc2\xa0Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills:Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability:Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands: This position requires constant moving and standing. Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs. \xc2\xa0May occasionally be required to reach, stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders. \xc2\xa0May have to reach above eye level. Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.
Other skills: Possess strong merchandising skills. Possess vision and creativity. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team. \xc2\xa0Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours:Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends,and/or holidays.

Description:
b"(To return to the job overview, please click your browser back button)
The Lead Impulse Stylist is a product and style expert who understands how to build a business through clienteling, communicating fashion trends, offering style advice and training other Impulse associates to do the same. The Stylist delivers memorable service and always makes the customer feel better for having visited Macy\xe2\x80\x99s.
\xc2\xa0
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Drive sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling and PACT coaching behaviors
Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer in making the best choice
Partner with Sales Manager to maximize vendor community trainings to drive product knowledge and educate peers,
Serve as a Role Model/Mentor to new hires
Proficient in POS systems, including Search and Send and My Client
Partner with Sales Manager to identify business driving opportunities to drive top line sales
Drive Presell events in partnership with Sales Manager and Associates, aware of promotional events
Track results and provide feedback and instruction on how to build My Client sales
Leverage My Macy\xe2\x80\x99s localization, by communicating Best Sellers and Key items to Sales Manager, and District Merchant
Develop My Client in order to regularly communicate: upcoming events, new merchandise receipts and product replenishment to increase incremental sales
Maintain back stock to support selling floor fill in, and stock management.
Fitting Room supervision on key selling days, communicate and lead effort to maintain fitting room standards and go-back process
Ensure shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Education/Experience: High School degree or equivalent. Minimum 1 year previous lead/supervisory position in a service and sales driven environment.
Language Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management.
Technical Skills: \xc2\xa0Understanding of mobile technology and emerging trends in shopping behaviors.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills. Demonstrates a customer-first mentality, ability to convert a customer into a client.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires constant moving and standing. Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours. Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs. May occasionally be required to stoop, kneel, crouch, and climb ladders. May have to reach above eye level
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to delegate and follow through on projects in a timely manner. Should possess a keen sense of fashion trends
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, weekends and key selling days

The Seasonal/Temporary Macy's By Appointment (MBA) Associate is responsible for developing personal shopping business by providing outstanding customer service, demonstrating superior product knowledge to customers, and creating a shopping experience that will make the customer feel welcome and comfortable during periods of high volume.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Acknowledge customers in a friendly and helpful manner within 30 seconds of their entry into the area
Handle all returns courteously and professionally
Develop a high level of product knowledge for the merchandise in the department by reading vendor tags, pamphlets, and attending training classes in order to communicate it to the customer
Suggest additional merchandise to compliment customer selection and engage the customer
Offer to call other locations if merchandise is unavailable within store
Offer to put purchase on customer\xe2\x80\x99s Macy\xe2\x80\x99s charge account toward the end of the shopping experience
Reinforce customer\xe2\x80\x99s selection and package merchandise with care
Invite customers to come back and thank them by name whenever possible
Responsible for achieving personal sales goals, hourly sales productivity rates, and Star Reward goalsMaintain a professional attitude with sincerity and enthusiasm reflecting Macy\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to our customer-the most important person in our stores
Develop clientele customer list and increase department sales
Follow up on purchases through e-mails, phone calls, or thank you cards
Cross sell throughout the store to maximize customer satisfaction and store sales
Complete support tasks such as recovering the fitting rooms and straightening merchandise as needed
Be proficient in POS and MPOS systems including Search and Send, My Client and More@ Macy\xe2\x80\x99s tablet app
Proactive in assisting customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment (i.e. BOPs), and have the ability to qualify customer needs, figure out what's right for them, and then get them in touch with the right associate, MBA, or Personal Shopper.
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
Be aware of back stock and fill as needed
Be aware of current promotional events and sales
Assist sales manager or vendors with special events as needed
Maintain good housekeeping standards
Adhere to Loss Prevention and inventory control and compliance procedures
Perform other duties as needed
Follows shortage programs and procedures\xc2\xa0
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor\xc2\xa0
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

\xc2\xa0
QUALIFICATIONS:

Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High School Diploma or equivalent. \xc2\xa0A minimum of one year of related experience and/or training.
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing. \xc2\xa0Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Involves lifting at least 30 lbs. \xc2\xa0May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. \xc2\xa0Vision abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Must be able to function as part of a team. \xc2\xa0Possess a strong sense of urgency. \xc2\xa0Must enjoy meeting and interacting with customers. \xc2\xa0Possess a thirst for learning. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.

Title: b"Seasonal/Temporary Macy's By Appointment (MBA) Associate:"

Description:
b"(To return to the job posting, please click your browser back button)
Job Overview: \xc2\xa0
As a Sales Floor Recovery Associate at Macy's, you will be a critical link in ensuring that our customers have a rewarding experience that will keep them coming back time after time. You will be required to move between selling areas as directed to maintain high customer readiness standards. You will deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment, while building quality customer relationships that result in increased sales and repeat business. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to demonstrating MAGIC Selling Skills and other operational tasks as assigned. This position is only in our Extreme Hard Shop Locations. Performs other duties as assigned.
Seasonal associates perform the same tasks and functions as a regular associate in the same role, but for a temporary period of time, typically through December 26, although some positions may work a few weeks longer. The number of scheduled hours each week may vary depending on need or position type.
Essential Functions:

Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through the heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration
Drive sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling Skills
Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority
Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer in making the best choice
Demonstrate a professional, can-do attitude
Maintain high customer readiness standards: deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment
Recover merchandise from fitting rooms
Assist in replenishment of stock onto the sales floor
Participate in selling floor and stockroom maintenance and organization
Be sensitive to store\xe2\x80\x99s business needs and flex into other areas as needed
Maintain communication with Store Team, for support on driving sales, promos, and product knowledge Adhere to all safety and security policies and procedures
Ensure shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Qualifications:

Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management.
Other Skills: Ability to work as part of a team, or independently with minimal direct supervision.Strong customer selling orientation. Demonstrates a customer-first mentality. Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities and open to learning new procedures.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position requires heavy lifting and constant moving and standing
Work Hours: Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including evenings and weekends

Macy's is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. \xc2\xa0Macy's will consider for employment qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of SFPC Art. 49."

Title: b'Retail Sales Associate:'

Description:
b'The Macy's Seasonal Retention Application posting period is open now through Saturday, December 26th! \xc2\xa0
Follow the steps below to access and complete the application:\xc2\xa0

To access the seasonal retention career site, click the "Post Holiday Employment Interest" icon your MyCareer page in InSITE, or click here to access the seasonal retention career site.
Type the name of your location into the "Keywords" box, and then click the "Search for Jobs" button.
Find the "Interest in Post-Holiday Employment" job posting for your location, and click the job posting title to open the posting and complete your seasonal retention application. \xc2\xa0Please complete an application for your current location only.

All seasonal associates interested in regular employment after the holiday season must complete a seasonal retention application no later than Saturday, December 26, 2015 in order to be considered. \xc2\xa0Seasonal associates who do not complete a retention application will be taken off roll at the end of their seasonal assignment, no later than Friday, January 23, 2015.
Seasonal associates should complete a retention application for their current location only; seasonal retention applications for locations in addition to or locations in place of the current location will not be considered. \xc2\xa0
See your HR Manager or Administrative Support Team member for assistance in accessing/completing the seasonal retention application. \xc2\xa0Your supervisor can give you additional details on the process. \xc2\xa0
Please note that the completion of the seasonal retention application only serves to express your interest in remaining employed with Macy's after the completion of your seasonal employment period. \xc2\xa0Seasonal temporary associates must meet the same criteria for continued employment as a regular associate, including meeting seasonal period performance standards/expectations and completion of the seasonal employment period.
If you are not actively employed at the end of the seasonal period, this internal application will be withdrawn from consideration. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
[Updated 10/19/15]
Macy's, Inc. \xc2\xa0is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. \xc2\xa0Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of SFPC Art. 49.
\xc2\xa0'

Title: b'Regional Make Up Artist: Pro Team Region'

Description:
b"As Macy's Backstage Store Manager, you will be responsible for providing leadership to the entire store team. \xc2\xa0You and your team will drive sales by driving a strong customer centric, fun and engaging culture. \xc2\xa0All storewide activities related to selling, merchandising, store maintenance, expense management, shortage prevention and sales support functions are under your direction. \xc2\xa0The store manager will develop a team of executives and associates through coaching, follow up and recognition. \xc2\xa0Perform other duties as necessary.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Sales

Drive sales by driving a customer centric, fun and engaging culture\xc2\xa0
Develop team of executives and associates through coaching, follow-up and recognition
Effectively communicate merchandise needs to the central merchant organization
Provide leadership in delivery of all Company initiatives and clearly communicate objectives and priorities to team
Coach direct report managers using the weekly Scorecard metrics
Celebrate and recognize individual and team success
Ensure \xe2\x80\x9cExecutive in Charge\xe2\x80\x9d (EIC) presence throughout the store
Ensure that all company communications, policies and practices are in place\xc2\xa0
Maintain high customer readiness standards, deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop environment
Ensure that appropriate staffing levels are met
Flex team members as necessary to provide appropriate coverage of cash wrap, fitting rooms, floor recovery, etc.
Monitor queue line to adjust staffing as necessary for line busting
Recruit a positive and engaging team of executives and team members
Build a culture of recognition by executing Macy\xe2\x80\x99s recognition programs
Ensure all team members receive appropriate training and onboarding
Lead team to support giving back to the local community, helping create stronger, healthier places to live and work
Perform other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0A minimum of 5 years of retail management experience, off-price preferred
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents, such as reports and procedure manuals. \xc2\xa0Excellent verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Ability to understand key metrics including sales, profitability, shortage calculations and retail math.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team. Must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing. \xc2\xa0Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Involves lifting at least 30 lbs. \xc2\xa0May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. \xc2\xa0Optical abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.\xc2\xa0
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Must be able to function as part of a team and collaborate with team members. \xc2\xa0Possess a strong sense of urgency. \xc2\xa0Must enjoy meeting and interacting with customers. \xc2\xa0Possess a thirst for learning. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays, based on department and store/company needs.
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Last Updated Date: 3/4/15
\xc2\xa0"
Title: b"Store Manager - Macy's Backstage:"

Description:
b"A Macy's Backstage Team Member is responsible for providing outstanding customer service, creating a shopping experience that will make the customer feel welcome and comfortable, operating cash registers and mobile pos stations, executing proper product placement and flow, floor moves, replenishment, inventory, shortage control, stockroom organization, ensuring markdowns are taken in a timely and accurate manner, set-up and removal of signs as directed for promotional events or sales. \xc2\xa0A Team Member is also responsible unloading and unpacking new merchandise when delivered, processing merchandise, floor recovery \xc2\xa0and performing other duties as necessary.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Be proficient in POS and MPOS systems
Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority
Handle all returns courteously and professionally
Suggest additional merchandise to compliment customer selection
Offer to put purchase on customer\xe2\x80\x99s Macy\xe2\x80\x99s charge account
Reinforce customer\xe2\x80\x99s selection and package merchandise with care
Invite customers to come back and thank them by name whenever possible
Maintain a positive attitude with sincerity and enthusiasm reflecting Macy\xe2\x80\x99s commitment to our customer-the most important person in our stores
Be knowledgeable of and perform sales support functions related to POS procedures
Maintain department recovery standards, including fitting room go backs\xc2\xa0
Receive and unload new merchandise from truck
Unpack merchandise from vendor boxes and remove merchandise from plastic bags and packaging
Take photos of new merchandise and upload to sharepoint
Place sensors on goods according to MSS standards, hang or fold merchandise and place on racks to be taken to the selling floor
Assist in the movement of fixtures and merchandise for new product, season changes, and clearance sets
Assist customers carrying large purchases to parking lot as needed
Recover shopping carts from parking lot as needed
Mark correct price on merchandise based on price changes and markdowns
Execute set-up and removal of signs for the entire store timely and accurately
Use RF scanning equipment to determine mark downs\xc2\xa0
Adhere to Asset Protection and inventory control and compliance procedures
Follow shortage programs and procedures\xc2\xa0
Maintain store cleanliness standards, including cash wrap, back office and restrooms as needed
Perform the abovenoted functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor\xc2\xa0
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality
Perform other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0No specific educational degree is required. \xc2\xa0
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents, such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. \xc2\xa0Excellent verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator.\xc2\xa0
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team. Must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving, talking, hearing, reaching, and standing. \xc2\xa0Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Involves lifting at least 30 lbs. \xc2\xa0May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. \xc2\xa0Optical abilities include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.\xc2\xa0
Other Skills: \xc2\xa0Must be able to function as part of a team and collaborate with team members. \xc2\xa0Possess a strong sense of urgency. \xc2\xa0Must enjoy meeting and interacting with customers. \xc2\xa0Possess a thirst for learning.. \xc2\xa0Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays, based on department and store/company needs.
_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
Last Updated Date: 3/4/15"

Title: b"Assistant Store Manager - Macy's Backstage:"

Description:
b"As a Seasonal Retail Stock Associate, you will be an integral part of bringing the magic of Macy\xe2\x80\x99s to life during the fast-paced holiday season and perform a number of functions that are critical in offering our customers the best experience when they shop in our stores. \xc2\xa0Seasonal associates perform the same tasks and functions as a regular associate in the same role, but for a temporary period of time, typically through December 26, although some positions may work a few weeks longer.
All seasonal associates may be required to work hours other than those stated in the job posting title or job overview, on weekends, and/or on key holiday events, such as the Friday after Thanksgiving. \xc2\xa0Hours are subject to change based on business needs.
There are two key Seasonal Retail Support roles: \xc2\xa0Seasonal Retail Stock Receiving and Seasonal Retail Stock Merchandising
Seasonal Retail Stock Receiving Essential Functions

Complete all processing and receiving activities in accordance with productivity standards/timelines
Responsible for customer carry-outs and special deliveries
Participate in stockroom maintenance, organization and housekeeping
Perform other duties as assigned
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Seasonal Retail Stock Receiving Qualifications

Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0 High school diploma or equivalent. \xc2\xa0
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to read, write, and interpret documents such as memos, safety rules, policies and procedures. \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate with peers and management
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities, and learn new procedures. \xc2\xa0Ability to work as part of a team, but also able to complete tasks independently with minimal supervision
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position may involve frequent lifting, bending, reaching and the use of ladders and other equipment. \xc2\xa0
Other Skills: \xc2\xa0Demonstrates a sense of urgency and positive attitude
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Ability to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, holidays, and sales events, based on department and store/company need. \xc2\xa0Hours are subject to change based on business needs

\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Seasonal Retail Stock Merchandising Essential Functions

Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration
Process merchandise to floor-ready standards and assist the Merchandise Team Lead with the placement of merchandise on the sales floor
Place product to appeal to customer preference; maintain high customer-readiness standards by delivering a clean, neat and easy to shop store environment
Communicate issues to Manager and or Merchandise Team Lead
Process damages, transfers and return to vendor merchandise
Perform other duties as assigned
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

Seasonal Retail Stock Merchandising Qualifications\xc2\xa0

Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High school diploma or equivalent. \xc2\xa0
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate with peers and management\xc2\xa0
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. \xc2\xa0Able to use a calculator and calculate percentages and ratios. \xc2\xa0Must be able to make change in American monetary units
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team. \xc2\xa0Must have good time management skills
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving and standing. \xc2\xa0Must be able to stand for at least two consecutive hours. \xc2\xa0Must be able to lift at least 30 lbs. \xc2\xa0May occasionally be required to reach, stoop, kneel, crouch and climb ladders. \xc2\xa0May have to reach above eye level. \xc2\xa0Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception and focus adjustment.
Other Skills: \xc2\xa0Possess strong merchandising skills. \xc2\xa0Possess vision and creativity. \xc2\xa0Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team. \xc2\xa0Must possess a strong sense of urgency. \xc2\xa0Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of radio frequency (RF) equipment
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0 Ability to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, holidays, and sales events, based on department and store/company need. \xc2\xa0Hours are subject to change based on business needs

\xc2\xa0
These job descriptions are not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend these job descriptions at any time. Macy's Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
6/10/15\xc2\xa0"

Title: b'Seasonal Retail Support - Receiving, Merchandising (San Francisco):'

Description:
b"The Connect@Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Specialist is an exceptional sales associate whose primary function is to connect with clients and provide one-on-one service and demonstrates MAGIC selling throughout the store. \xc2\xa0This person creates an enhanced shopping experience and drives repeat sales by creating relationships, leveraging the My Client tool. \xc2\xa0S/he uses product knowledge tools, technology and superior selling skills to drive sales. \xc2\xa0The Connect@ Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Specialist is an expert on the merchandise s/he sells and is highly knowledgeable and conversant in current trends and customer reviews. \xc2\xa0The Connect@Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Specialist is proficient in using mobile devices and leveraging digital content. \xc2\xa0S/he eagerly embraces new technologies and uses them to drive incremental sales. \xc2\xa0The Connect@Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Specialist reports directly to the VPSM and Connect@Macy\xe2\x80\x99s Lead; and proactively advocates for the customer. In addition, this person communicates customer opportunities to the store and district teams as needed.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Drives sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling skills, leveraging technology to optimize inventories across all channels; provides a relevant, seamless and fun one-to-one customer experience
Develops repeat business using My Client to regularly communicate upcoming events, new merchandise receipts and product replenishment to generate incremental sales, whether the client is in the store or not
Provides an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority, whether or not it culminates in a sale
Proactively assists customers who are using devices to shop and compare, whether Macy\xe2\x80\x99s devices or their own
Leverages product knowledge and digital resources (product descriptions, customer reviews, etc.) to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer and expanding merchandise options to enable the best choices
Communicates regularly with District Merchant (DM) and Planners (DP) regarding stock needed to drive sales
Collaborates with Sales Manager, DM, RDM and vendors for support on driving sales promotion and optimizing technology and product knowledge
Utilizes My Customer feedback log to communicate assortment opportunities
Serves as role model for peers and mentor for new hires on Product Knowledge, My Client and use of mobile devices to generate incremental sales
Achieves performance goals; must be results-oriented
Demonstrates a professional, \xe2\x80\x9ccan do\xe2\x80\x9d attitude
Maintains high customer readiness standards: delivers a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment
Is proficient in POS and MPOS systems including Search and Send, My Client and More@Macy\xe2\x80\x99s tablet app
Ensures shortage prevention initiatives are executed
Performs other customer-facing, duties as needed
Demonstrates regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience: \xc2\xa0High School degree or equivalent required. Minimum 1 year previous selling or retail experience required.
Communication Skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management.
Mathematical Skills: \xc2\xa0Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction and calculating percentages coupled with ability to use a calculator fluidly.
Reasoning Ability: \xc2\xa0Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team. Must have good time management skills. Demonstrates ability to build relationships and convert customers into clients.
Physical Demands: \xc2\xa0This position involves constant moving and standing. Involves standing a minimum of two consecutive hours. Involves lifting at least 30 lbs. May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. May have to reach above eye level.
Other skills: \xc2\xa0Ability to follow through on projects in a timely manner. Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment.
Work Hours: \xc2\xa0Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays.
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. \xc2\xa0Macy's, Inc. will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of\xc2\xa0SFPC Art. 49.
\xc2\xa0
Updated Date: 7/10/15"
Title: b"Connect@Macy's Specialist:"

Description:
b"All hourly Downtown Pittsburgh associates impacted by the July 13th announcement must complete a Placement Consideration Application, and those interested in continuing with Macy's in a nearby location (within 25 miles of the Downtown store) have the opportunity to express an interest in interviewing for placement. \xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
Associates that are interested in interviewing for an opportunity within a nearby Macy's location should complete the placement consideration application for his/her\xc2\xa0FIRST CHOICE location for\xc2\xa0placement.\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0

Even though you're only completing one placement application for your first choice, you will still have the opportunity to enter a second and third choice location on that application. \xc2\xa0

Below are links to the Placement Consideration Application for each nearby placement location; click and complete an application only for your #1 placement location choice: \xc2\xa0
Click here if your first choice placement location is Ross Park Mall
Click here if your first choice placement location is Ross Park Furniture
Click here if your first choice placement location is South Hills Village
Click here if your first choice placement location is South Hills Furniture
Click here if your first choice placement location is Mall at Robinson
Click here if your first choice placement location is Monroeville Mall
Click here if your first choice placement location is Beaver Valley Mall
Click here if your first choice placement location is The Waterfront
Click here if your first choice placement location is Century III Mall
Click here if your first choice placement location is Washington Crown Centre
Click here if your first choice placement location is Galleria at Pittsburgh Mills
Within a few days, you will receive an interview invitation via e-mail, and must click the link in the e-mail to select your interview date and time. \xc2\xa0All interviews will take place within the Downtown Pittsburgh location, with hiring representatives from the nearby Macy's locations conducting the interviews.
If you're unable to find an interview slot that works with your personal schedule, please reach out to your HR Manager at (412) 232-4158, extension 1155.
In the event your\xc2\xa0preferred first choice placement location is unable to extend a placement offer following your interview, you may be matched to your second choice placement location and have the opportunity to select an interview date and time with your second choice location.
Please reach out to your HR manager with any questions on the process at (412) 232-4158, extension 1155."
Title: b'Downtown Pittsburgh Placement Consideration Process:'

Description:
b'To return to the job posting, please click your browser "back" button
Holiday Seasonal position to support store teams in creating an engaged seasonal workforce to utilize all hours to drive sales and MAGIC.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Review Open Hours, Associate Actual Hours Scheduled, 1st Shift worked reports and communicate opportunities to store leadership
Work with sales managers in filling open hours current and future weeks
Validate with sales managers seasonals have initial schedule
Monitor average hours scheduled for seasonals
As part of store leadership team, support stores in educating seasonals hires on how to utilize self- service tools via My Page
Ensure MSP/MyPage training at end of seasonal New Hire training sessions occurs
Assist Sales Managers in facilitating Open House/Pick Up Parties and additional training of seasonal new hire
Ensure Seasonal associates attend their first day of Training, to prevent no-shows and create a relationship
Present weekly review of Investment Strategy Group initiatives and recovery hours at store leadership meetings
Manage Fixed Base schedules for OFR, Recovery, and vendor paid positions
Perform these functions in an efficient manner, as directed by the Supervisor
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality

QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience\xc2\xa0
High School degree or equivalent. Prior experience a plus.
Language Skills \xc2\xa0
Effective written and verbal skills, ability to interpret instructional documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. \xc2\xa0Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Mathematical Skills \xc2\xa0
Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator.
Reasoning Ability \xc2\xa0
Self-starter, able to work independently and as part of a team and must have good time management skills.
Physical Demands\xc2\xa0\xc2\xa0
This position involves constant moving and standing. Involves standing for at least two \xc2\xa0consecutive hours and lifting at least 30 lbs. May occasionally involve reaching, stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. May involve reaching above eye level. Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment.
Other Skills\xc2\xa0
MSP Systems Knowledge is beneficial. Ability to collaborate and function as a member of a team. \xc2\xa0Must possess a strong sense of urgency. Should be comfortable with the use of computers
Work Hours \xc2\xa0
Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays.
This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy\xe2\x80\x99s, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.\xc2\xa0'
